review.title: Heart of san francisco, easy access to all points
review.reviewText: The hotel doesn't have a grand lobby, so first impression can be underwhelming. However, the rooms were large and comfortable, staff was awesome, and location perfect. I would recommend, and would be happy to stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel in great downtown location
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and clean. The bed very comfy. Convenient location right next to the cable car line and a short walk to other public transportation. The staff was very friendly. I would stay again.

review.title: Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: Minutes walk from Chinatown, Union Square, busses & trolley. 20 Minute Uber ride to the SFO airport. Seriously great location. Price was reasonable for San Fransisco, rooms were clean & very quiet (other than the sound of the trolley system underneath the streets- you could here that but it wasn't over the top). My only real complaint was that the water pressure in the shower was almost non-existent. Other than that, would likely stay here again.

review.title: Nice and helpful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was good but the best experience gained was the helpful staff that took there time to explain what to do and where. The rooms were clean and very comfortable

review.title: Overnight Stay in Quiet Hotel
review.reviewText: An excellent experience in a very clean room walking distance from Union Square and Chinatown.  My last trip to San Francisco I stayed at a more expensive hotel by Fisherman's Warf and I didn't sleep well at all because of the night time noise.  At this hotel it was more quiet at night than staying at home and I woke up feeling refreshed and ready for the day.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Only thing to consider about staying here is check in time is 3PM and they are strict about that.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in time could be earlier, like about noon?
review.locationRemarks: Near the Bart station, cable cars, Chinatown, shopping, and restaurants.

review.title: Boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Conveniently situated to transport, shopping and tourist areas.  Responsive, courteous service.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, trolley line, shopping and walking distance to other attractions

review.title: Nice hotel conveniently situated
review.reviewText: Within a 2 block (uphill) walk from Union Square and right on cable car line.  Staff are friendly and room well appointed, clean, and comfortable.  Ideally situated to explore dining, shopping, or museums by foot or cable car. Would seriously consider staying again on future visits.

review.title: horrible experience over all
review.reviewText:
there are not enough characters allowed to properly explain my horrible experience at this hotel. So in a nut shell I will not ever stay at this hotel again, nor will I recommend it to anyone. 
If you like to be charged for your stay 3 times and be charged for things that they wont even tell you what they are for & don't have to worry about a budget then by all means go ahead.
review.positiveRemarks: the room its self was nice and clean
review.negativeRemarks: The manager (Spencer) was a jerk and refused to be of any help at all.
review.locationRemarks: hotel was near/in Union square so it was in a good location. close to shopping and the Cable Car stop.

review.title: Beautiful, central location in San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
I was taking my daughter to college in San Francisco, and am so very glad that I chose the Orchard Hotel.   The location is perfect in terms of walking about or taking the cable car (a stop is right outside the hotel).

The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable, and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful or friendly.   I will definitely stay here again when visiting San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing comes to mind
review.locationRemarks: The Orchard Hotel is right on the Powell and Bush St. cable car stop, and is in the center of wonderful restaurants and markets.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, great location and friendly helpful staff.

review.title: Nice hotel close to all the action
review.reviewText: Was really happy with the hotel's location, cleanliness and staff. It is located at Bush and Powell so within walking distance to Union Square and all the shops, Market St and all the shops and Chinatown. There is cable car access right outside the hotel that can get you right to the Wharf. There are numerous restaurants and bars all within walking distance and it is close to a car rental if you need that for a trip. Nothing negative to say here.
Great location near Union Square within walking distance to lots of great sites.

review.title: Orchard Hotel is perfect all around.
review.reviewText:
We recently stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 2 nights in mid July.  It was very expensive for our Canadian dollar exchange, and normally I would not think the price was worth it...I was wrong.  The service at the hotel was exceptional - front desk valet, and concierge were above and beyond.  Very helpful from simple direction requests to recommendations for best places to eat off the beaten path, ideas for not to miss things to see as well as places to avoid for safety reasons.  

I highly recommend the Orchard Hotel and hope to be back.  Thank you to Darnell...he was truly awesome.  :)
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is walking distance to many attractions in San Francisco - cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, China Town, etc.  Fabulous.

review.title: Short stay in SF
review.reviewText: Orchard Hotel was very clean and comfy. The staff was extremely welcoming. And the location was great. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a great part of town. Would recommend to a short or longer term visitor.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was great...particularly Joe....very helpful and accommodating. Location was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Good location at Cable car stop and near Chinatown.

review.title: Great location, great hotel
review.reviewText: From check in to check we did not have one issue with the staff or hotel. Room was great very spacious bathroom. Would stay again and recommend to anyone. Cable car went straight past the corner of the hotel so access to the piers was easy and being so close to union square was great for shopping and dinning.

review.title: Great hotel- good location
review.reviewText: Orchard was great and the staff were all wonderful. Will stay again in the future. The room was nice and had a great experience at the Orchard hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and easy access to the areas of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: None at this time
review.locationRemarks: Location was close to restaurants,the sights and safe.

review.title: Convenient to all of San Fran
review.reviewText: Nice, clean hotel with an excellent, helpful, very friendly staff. Hotel is located conveniently to all things to do in San Fran (I.e., not far from Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Chocolate, Chinatown, etc). This is not a hotel to exercise at though as their workout room is a vacant hotel room with an elliptical & a treadmill. Also, there was only one ice machine working in the hotel & it was located on the 6th floor. My wife & I did discover Uncle Vito's Pizzaria, located about 200 feet from the hotel, & we ate there 4 times during our six day stay! Everything was delicious, especially the pizza, burgers, & sautéed mushrooms!! Their prices are reasonable too for this high priced city. Highly recommend

review.title: Very nice hotel and great location.
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay.  Unfortunately, we had to leave a day early because my daughter was ill.  We were still charged due to Expedias policy which is unfortunate.

review.title: Great hotel right off Union Square.
review.reviewText: First time stay, we found the Orchard very centrally located and close to Union Square.  Hotel and rooms felt very fresh and new, dining room had terrific breakfast selection.  All staff whether front desk, dining room, front door proved friendly and very helpful for everything from public transportation, travel directions to China town dinner suggestions.  Would def stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were very nicely appointed and everything felt very fresh.
review.negativeRemarks: It's all pretty darn good.
review.locationRemarks: We wanted central, Union Square and convenient.  The Orchard has it.  Walk to Union Square and China town and catch a cable car on Powell.

review.title: Was there for a convention.
review.reviewText: Great great location!   Great staff.   Super cumfy beds -  impeccable cleaningness

review.title: Fantastic hotel, great location
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and couldn't have been happier with hotel choice. Really close to shops, cafes, restaurants and cable car line. Friendly door man. Rooms were spacious and super quiet. Nice comfortable beds and pillows. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, lovely large room, tastefully decorated. Very helpful and friendly staff.

review.title: Central location, safe, comfortable, good amenity
review.reviewText:
The Orchard hotel is handy to everything.  The cable car is just outside the door,  Union Square is a short walk down the hill, the trolly cars are also within walking distance. The car rental depot was just across the road as well so I was very happy with the location. There are lots of good cafes and restaurants very close by for breakfast and dinner. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on their restaurant also it did look inviting.
The amenities were very good and the staff were friendly and helpful.
The only slight negative was the humming of the elevator in our room even though we weren't right next to it. The noise didn't keep us awake or bother us, it was just a sound that you noticed.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was very good for the room rate and the rooms were very comfortable with very nice amenities
review.negativeRemarks: Because you were right on the street front,  which I liked for the view of the city buildings, it would have been better to have double gazed windows.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car at your door, restaurants and cafes very close by, walking distance to China Town and Union Square, walking distance to trolly cars

review.title: Enjoyed the Very Clean Room and the Good Location.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is located close to the Union Squire and 5 mins. walk distance to Powell St. station on Market St.  You can catch the cable cars on Powell St., take Muni street cars and buses on Market St, and take Muni Metro and Bart from the Powell. St. station.
The room of the Orchard Hotel was so clean that I stayed there veeerry comfortably. 
The clean staff who was in charge of the room, left his/her name card on the desk each day. 
I am certain I will stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to be improved
review.locationRemarks: Several steps to Powell St. Enjoying relaxing time in the Union Square, eating at the food court in Westfield San Francisco Center.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful-- both the concierge and front desk.  The hotel is only a block or two out of the main activity.  Great value for the money compared to other hotels in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Downtown Santa Barbara
review.reviewText:
Last minute booking but was worth it. Small room, but very helpful and friendly staff. Super continental breakfast.
Great hotel location, restaurants and stores on the street.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, breakfast, location, and parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Price
review.locationRemarks: Great location central to everything!

review.title: business trip
review.reviewText: Quiet restful hotel very close to Union Sq.  Staff helpful, room large and excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I found.
review.locationRemarks: Central San Francisco is very mixed - nice areas mixed in with rather tatty and seedy areas.  This hotel, like most in the area, is near the border.

review.title: Nice hotel downtown
review.reviewText: Room doesn't  have USB port anywhere to charge electronic devices,  which is very unusual for hotels nowadays
review.positiveRemarks: Room is clean, bed is comfortable, a/c temperature is user friendly and quiet
review.negativeRemarks: Equip USB ports asap

review.title: Room double assignments and room service mess
review.reviewText:
20 minutes after checking-in and getting comfortable in my room, I heard a noise at the door; gentlemen swiped his key card and walked in with a suitcase. I have never had a hotel provide room keys to a room that is occupied! 
Room service was completely wrong, didn't even touch it. Luckily the hotel service desk removed the charge during check out. 
Room wasn't very clean. Hair on bed linens and bathroom sink and shower. Would not stay here or recommend for business travelers.
review.negativeRemarks: Out dated, not very clean, disorganized office

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Would go back again.  We didn't know that the hotel had a car that could pick you up at the airport for the same price as a taxi.  We used to to return to the airport.
review.locationRemarks: near theater, restaurants and China town.  Can walk everywhere from the hotel.

review.title: my absolute favorite place to stay.
review.reviewText: clean, close to theaters, wonderful breakfast places in both directions. friendly, welcoming staff and extremely comfortable and quiet room. love this place.
review.positiveRemarks: i love everything about this hote. even the elevator
review.negativeRemarks: not a thing.
review.locationRemarks: near the theater district.

review.reviewText: Hotel is nice enough but not luxurious. Better hotel options in the Union Square area.
Hotel staff provided great service.  Rooms clean and comfortable.

Excellent hotel. Would stay here again. 

Negatives: there were stains on my carpet - the main one was cleaned after I requested it. This was the only downside (the carpet was hoovered, but not thoroughly cleaned with cleaning product/water). If you're a light sleeper, you can hear when others open/close doors or talk. But it's not that bad at all. 

I was also a solo traveller and felt incredibly comfortably here.
review.negativeRemarks: There were stains on my carpet. The room had obviously been cleaned and hoovered, but the carpet had not been cleaned besides hoovering.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations. It was much nicer than the usual Hilton/Hyatt type room I usually stay in. Most important, my wife liked it.

review.title: Great small hotel in a big city!
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived, staff was so friendly and helpful.  The location is steps from the Powell/Hyde cable car route.  It is a few blocks from Union Square and a fun cable car ride to the Wharf and the waterfront.  We loved this hotel and the staff!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is so friendly that you feel welcome at once.  Then the room was clean and lovely to stay in.  We look forward to going back!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is walking distance from Union Square and only steps from the Powell/Hyde cable car line.  Chinatown is a few blocks away.

review.title: Nice Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I was in SF for a conference, but the conference hotel was booked. Looked around & found this place quite near Union Square (and my meeting) was very pleasantly surprised. Older hotel, but very well maintained. Not the place for you if you need a pool and a gym (I try to run even on the road, so this wasn't a big deal)
review.positiveRemarks: Location (for my needs) was great. Service was excellent (great staff). Room was spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI took a call to the IT number to get working; my biggest gripe was the lack on an in room coffee pot! There was coffee in the lobby, but still
review.locationRemarks: The location is about two blocks from Union Square - that's pretty much all you need to know!

review.title: The kindest and most attentive staff I've seen
review.reviewText: For brief four day stay, the staff at this hotel provided a level of care and response, unlike any I've seen in San Francisco. Location is very convenient.

review.title: Lovely hotel in great position
review.reviewText: Staff were great.  The wooden base on the beds were easy to bump into so ended up with a lot of leg bruises.  Had to ask for a coffee machine and the safe did not work.
review.negativeRemarks: see experience above

review.title: An unexpected great find
review.reviewText:
Everything we had heard of before was sold out so we found a couple of rooms still available at the Orchard Hotel so we decided to stay there.

Rooms were large and clean. Staff were very helpful and respectful.
We would stay again.

review.title: Hotel was convenient.
review.reviewText: Right next to cable car stop. Shopping was just down the hill Union Square.

review.title: Nice Hotel for Touring San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was great except for one complaint. There was no access to coffee except in the hotel restaurant each morning. Coffee was available throughout the remainder of the day in the lobby. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. This hotel is very convenient to all tourist attractions, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and comfortable- good sized rooms, friendly staff. Location is great for Union Square and surrounds plus cable cars.

review.title: Nice Downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleased with my stay.  I was relieved  how nice the hotel was.  I had never heard of the hotel prior to staying there.  It was my first time to San Francisco so I didn't know what I was getting in to.

review.title: Great Hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Our 4 night stay here couldn't have been better. The staff was very helpful with restraurant and navigation tips. The hotels breakfast was very good and our room was very comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was awesome and very helpful. The room was clean and very nice. The location was a short walk to Chinatown, trolleys and to Bart.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. Loved it.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Nice boutique hotel perfectly located for trams buses and Bart. Breakfast pricey for what you get but then this is SF. find a cafe instead.

review.title: Perfect location, very comfortable room
review.reviewText: I am only disappointed with Expedia as it advertise this hotel with breakfast included and is not. Other wise a very good place to stay

review.title: Great location close to union square
review.reviewText:
Good location for Union Square, cable cars etc. 
large comfortable room with fridge
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, particularly in hallways
review.locationRemarks: Cable car rides to fisherman  wharf. Handy for F line and restaurants and shops.

review.title: Beautifully remodeled
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was in a great location for walking, or riding the trolley (steps away but crowded).  The weather was very warm, so we were able to go to our room for a mid-day break to rest and cool off.  It was beautifully remodeled.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt safe.  Nice room and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel was a bit stingy with supplies such as toilet paper, which was delivered on request one roll at a time.  Also had to request a coffee maker.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent breakfasts at restaurant on the corner.

review.title: A wonderful well located stay
review.reviewText: The staff was very professional, specially Cornell, who always greet us with a big smile and was ready to help when needed.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Very convenient hotel. Walking distance to everything .  Staff where friendly but not overly.  Cleaning staff took care of our room nicely. Only real complaint is that we love to work out daily and if we wanted a real gym it was $30 per day for the two of us.

review.title: Excellent hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with really helpful staff in a great location close to Union Square. Rooms were better tan expected and bed was a dream.
review.negativeRemarks: Not  a lot. Didn't try the restaurant. Was really happy with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping just down Powell Street at Market Street. Cold beer in the sun at Union Square, great choice of restaurants plus all the tourist highlights.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: we had a room on the 9th floor backside of hotel.  It was HUGE for downtown San Francisco.  Staff was awesome and centrally located to downtown and also all transportation, trolley, street car, bus lines.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Excellent spot.

review.title: Great place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: the hotel rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms are large and clean. Don't pay more than 250$ a night. Rooms have AC

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a centralized location. Walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach, and fisherman's warf. Wide variety of shopping and restaurants close by.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText:
Really enjoyed the stay here. Welcome by the staff was great, room was very clean and comfortable. Location is perfect for downtown and the cable car stops on the corner of the block.
I would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, clean confortable room and great location
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in shower wasn't great and water didn't get that hot.
review.locationRemarks: What more could you want.

review.title: Good location, ok staff, clean comfy rooms
review.reviewText: Walking distance to China town, North Beach, & easy public transportation. Close to Wharf too. Staff ok, not overly friendly. Wifi good. Parking $50/night was steep. Room was comfy.
Hotel staff was so happy and willing to help with anything. Rooms are very clean and well appointed.

review.title: Quiet hotel close to major atractions
review.reviewText: Large room with nice style furniture. The only negative the valet parking rate in Expedia was 42 and arriving at the hotel they asked for 50. Very expensive. We don't like to be misinformed. Was the hotel or Expedia fault?
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet. Well situated but walking is not easy thing in SF. Very hilly.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking very expensive. A coffee machine in room.
review.locationRemarks: Union square at walking distance as well as the cable car and a lot of good restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel new Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice clean, comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Daytime baggage attendant was very knowledgeable and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: In room or lobby coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square, shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: We were staying for seven days, so we were very happy that the room was so clean and spacious. The beds were extremely comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was lovely. The young man at the desk was always knowledgeable and helpful about giving directions. The doormen were friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: We realize that San Francisco is a very expensive city, but $14.00 for a bowl of breakfast cereal was ridiculous. We made other arrangements every day
review.locationRemarks: Great access to China Town and the hop-on buses. Senior citizens with any knee issues should be warned about the steep inclines surrounding this hotel

review.title: Very centrally located
review.reviewText: Great location; great service!  City noise was not a problem.  Room temps were very pleasant (summer stay).
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and helpful!  Room was very generously sized.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in the room
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's wharf, North Beach and Union Square area.  Lots of restaurants, shopping nearby as well.

review.title: Convenient to all public transport
review.reviewText: Very good experience. Check in and out was ezpz. Bellman was very helpful. I would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant food was poor for price.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, access to public transport to museums

review.title: Excellent Location two blocks from Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard for three nights following two weeks of driving from Seattle. From the moment we parked in front of the hotel to the moment we left the service was exemplary.I have already recommended the Orchard to friends for the perfect place to stay when in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was incredibly comfortable. Perfect location. Friendly and helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was in an excellent location to shopping, restaurants, waterfront and sports events.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Chinatown and Union Square
review.reviewText: Bed was too soft for me but others would like it.  Staff were very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Loved the BED
review.reviewText: We were greeted by Alphonso and he hooked us up with a wonderful place for dinner.  But the best part was the quite room and awesome bed.  Sooooo comfortable.  Slept very well that night!  We will be going back to the Orchard.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the bed and location.  In the heart of San Fran and walking distance to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is by the best shopping in San Fran and the best restaurants.  Very close to the piers too!!

review.title: Great hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Quiet hotel but still very near to union square. Rooms are very clean and well maintained. Bathroom is immaculate and bed is very comfortable. Will stay again.

It was a nice hotel: clean, with friendly staff, and close to Union Square.  The only problem I had is that the restaurant was unexpectedly closed in the morning when I tried to go there for breakfast.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: Close to everything! Great staff, have no complaints.
Everything was perfect especially the location. What else can I say?

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: great location, clean room, room service came 3 times a day
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and door men were very friendly

review.title: Great Trip.
review.reviewText:
Check-In was Smooth, Rooms Clean, and the door man even knew about the Expos, and the C of Red.
We planned very little for our trip and took advice from the door man on where to go and how to get there.  We ended up eating some amazing food and having a great time.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in the room should be standard.  We asked for one and one was delivered with coffee, tea, and supplies within 2 minutes.
review.locationRemarks: Heart of shopping and food.  No need to rent a car as close to train lines which were a breeze to use.

review.title: Nice hotel right at a Cable Car stop
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Orchard Hotel a few years ago and am glad to report the level of service and quality for the value in San Fran continues to be excellent. The staff all the way from the doorman to the front desk to the house keeping staff are all very friendly and continued to welcome me and ask what they could do to make my stay better. The room was very spacious compared to other hotels I had researched before this stay.  The amenities also provide a value not common in most of the nicer San Fran hotels such as free Wifi and a mini-fridge in the room (granted they use it as a honor system mini bar but there is plenty of room to store items). My only qualm during my stay is that there is no microwave if I wished to reheat some of my wonderful leftovers that needed to be heated to enjoy. The bed was comfortable, the shower pressure was plenty, and though there are some aspects of the hotel which appear dated the overall comfort level was similar to that of some of the newer, more costly hotels. The best way to describe the hotel is all the comforts of a high end hotel with a mid class hotel price.
review.positiveRemarks: One of my favorite parts about this hotel is that there is a Cable Car stop right at the corner where the hotel sits.
review.negativeRemarks: As noted above, just a microwave in the room.
review.locationRemarks: About 2-3 blocks from famous Chinatown Dragon gate. Lots of shopping within a few blocks. And I can't say it enough, Cable Car stop on corner.

review.title: Well located for getting around.
review.reviewText: On intersection of tram route and close to Union Square for inexpensive local transport. Good breakfast cafe next door.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Rooms were very clean and spaces. The hotel staff was very helpful and nice.

review.title: Great Location. Very clean room. Good service.
review.reviewText:
I travel quite a bit and I am very paticular when booking a hotel room. Cleanliness is the biggest factor. This hotel was very clean. The location was also great. close to Union Square, Chinatown, Nob Hill - all within a short walk.
The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. The doormen were awesome and also very helpful with directions or suggestions for tourist.
would recomment this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: the hotel could use a facelift/renovation, especially the room with the outdated bathrooms/tubs.
review.locationRemarks: go shopping in Union Square. Walk the Chinatown for shopping or dinner. Walk to Nob Hill and see the sights

review.title: Great location. Comfortable bed.
review.reviewText: Desk and bell staff were very nice and courteous. Room was a bit small but comfortable. Just a few steps away from trolley that runs to Fisherman's Wharf. Great restaurants and bars within a 1-2 block walk. Will definitely consider Orchard for future visits to SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is expensive, but found a city parking lot within 2 blocks for about one-third of hotel provided parking.
review.locationRemarks: Good sushi and Italian restaurants within 1 block of front door. Nice perk having trolley stop within a few steps from front door.

review.title: Quiet and clean in a busy city.
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed for a few days as part of our honeymoon.  The hotel was in a great location, very clean and the room was very comfortable.  We slept great each night we were there.  The staff was great in helping us navigate the city and check in/out was very easy.

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: The orchard was excellent. I came for a weekend to visit the city and I don't know the city very well. The staff helped me immensely every step of the way with directions, recommendations, etc. I could not be happier with the comfort of the room and the speed of the free WIFI in the room. Overall the hotel was perfect! I will be back. Also, great location!

review.title: Convenient, Clean & Friendly
review.reviewText:
Orchard Hotel was conveniently located.  Within 30 minutes walk of many local attractions:  Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ferry Terminal, Chinatown, Cable Car Museum, Japantown, Lombard Street, Union Square.  Many restaurants nearby.

Staff was friendly and had good recommendations.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level from the street could be lower, but most hotels probably suffer this same issue in the area.

review.title: nice hotel close to union square, decent room.
review.reviewText: nice hotel close to union square, decent room. Only disadvantage is the plug-in is a little far from bed.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Too expensive.  But every hotel in San Francisco is overpriced.  It was a small hotel room that looked out over Bush Street nothing special to set it apart.  Nothing special.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car ran up and down Powell Street.  If you go to San Francisco to shop you won't be disappointed with the location.  Many of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel.  Great Staff.  Very much enjoyed staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe coffee in the rooms but this wasnt a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: You are right on union square, ten minutes walk from China Town, etc.  Perfect location.

review.title: Nice little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great little boutique hotel located in union square. Bus stops/cable cars within walking distance. The most comfortable hotel bed!! Unfortunately it's too noisy at night, but it's union square. Not much you can do about that.
review.negativeRemarks: The room windows cannot be opened! I don't understand why.

review.reviewText: Hotel was clean...centrally located to Chinatown, trolley stops and great restraunts in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Nice, super clean hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Everything is exceptionally clean here and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  There's not a lot of amenities but it's not that expensive either.  Very easy place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I've never seen a hotel room so completely spotless.  It's also very low key - didn't feel like the hotel was trying to get money out of me.
review.negativeRemarks: I had room service breakfast which was excellent except they didn't include butter and jam for the toast.

review.reviewText: Great, clean hotel. Close to many restaurants, cable car, shopping mall.  Staff is friendly.

review.title: Excellent Location and Outstanding Service
review.reviewText: This hotel is located downtown and within walking distance (bring comfortable shoes because the hills in San Fran are very steep) of China Town, shopping, more restaurants than imaginable, taverns, cable car pick-up, Fisherman's Wharf,  etc.  We walked the first time to Fisherman's Wharf, but we used Uber the other days, because it was fast, cheap, and easy! The rooms were very spacious, comfortable beds, and very clean.  The staff was very accommodating, friendly and helpful.  If we go back, we will be staying at this hotel!  You MUST do the Fire Engine Tour over the Golden Gate Bridge and to Presidio.  It was so informative and beautiful scenery because it is an open-air fire engine.  I give the Orchard Hotel a big thumbs-up and recommend it to everyone!
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the cleanliness, and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly I cannot think of a thing I would change!
review.locationRemarks: Very close to downtown, shopping, restaurants, taverns, and China Town.  Walking distance (bring comfy shoes-hills are step) to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.reviewText: The staff was helpful but not the least bit obtrusive.
review.negativeRemarks: A little more light in the room would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: We found ourselves close to so many tourist destinations.  Also found the sweetest coffee shop called Beanstalk, just across the street and down a few

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: This was a good home base for traveling solo in San Francisco. The room was nice and comfortable, and very quiet which I hear is hard to find in Union Square. It is in a safe location and right on the cable car line so you can hop it to the waterfront or to market street.
review.positiveRemarks: It was quiet, private, sage, and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant hours and room service. Also the bathroom drains were hard to use,
review.locationRemarks: Walk or hop the cable car to Nob Hill, Chinatown, North Beach Waterfront. Easy walk to Union Square, or to Market Street.

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, centrally located 6 blocks north of Powell Street BART stop. Easy access to walk to Union Square & shopping district. Convenient, friendly, clean, efficient hotel. Would stay again.

review.title: excellant
review.reviewText: room was very comfortable & clean. staff, particularly the doormen were very helpful in pointing out eateries & other assistance
review.negativeRemarks: everything was fine
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to tour buses & restaurants

review.reviewText: Great stay.  Staff was most helpful.  Rooms spacious and clean.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square and two from Chinatown

review.title: Nice boutique hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square. Within walking distance to a lot of sights. The cable car stops in a street adjacent to the hotel 50m away. Staff were very helpful.

review.title: 1 week stay in San Fran with my mum
review.reviewText:
Good location- super close to main buses, near to bart (underground). Love being so near to union square. 
Good convenience stores near by, good restaurants too. 

Room could do with some updating(prefer orchard garden) but it was clean and very very quiet. 

Would go back despite not being in love with the room  given that everyone is so helpful- from concierge to cleaners. 
Can't stress how great they are! - particularly want to mention Ben D (he's amazing!), Spencer and Nathan. 
Made our stay very enjoyable! We shall be heading back!!

Friendly staff. Bellman came all the way across the street to help with my bags. Great location. Diner next door was really good. Tavern around the corner was great. Room was clean and comfortable. They make an effort to be green.

review.title: Great Hotel and Great Location
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel in the heart of SF.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Nice modern decor and very clean rooms.  Many restaurants close by and Union Square is two blocks away.  Cable car is 1/2 block away.  We would definitely stay here again.
Well situated and so close to our car rental drop off on Bush St.. There is a very cozy cafe on the street corner that makes a great breakfast place to start your day.

review.title: Lovely Clean Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Had a room over looking the road and despite this the room was quiet. The hotel was clean and staff very friendly and helpful on the front desk.  Room and bathroom very spacious. The location was brilliant, two blocks away from Union Square and the cable car stops on the corner.  The only problem is that the hotel has a sister hotel down the road with a similar name, which confused the airport shuttle drivers both there and back (had to walk with my bags up two blocks (along San Francisco Hills).
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Easy to reach all parts of San Francisco from Hotel's Location by foot all public transport.

review.reviewText: Pleasant experience close to the trolley line and walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Financial District.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: the hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the best places to eat and go. I will be staying here again. thank you to everyone there that made our stay so wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: movie selection
review.locationRemarks: china town, pier 39, mikkellar craft beer bar, dotties for breakfast, golden gate park

review.title: The perfect hotel in SFO
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in the perfect location. 2 blocks from Union Square, its right in front of a stop of the cable car. You can walk to Chinatown etc. We had a room at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet and comfortable. The bed was simply amazing. My husband is 6'7'' and pretty large but I didn't feel him turning or getting up, which often happens in hotels. 
I am a Starbucks lover and there is one just around the corner. The staff were very helpful too so I really can't fault this hotel in any wy. If I come back to SFO, I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Excellent staff
review.reviewText: The staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. Our particular room did not have a view of anything besides a nearby building. Perhaps other rooms have more of a view.

Overall, we had a fine experience. The hotel staff for the most part were friendly and helpful. The room had a nice clean bed and clean bathroom. However, there was a musty smell evident as soon as I entered the room. Not sure if it's the carpet, but it was a bit overpowering.

The location is excellent for Union Square, Chinatown, etc...

And like I said, for the most part the staff was helpful with one exception. We were given the wrong directions to meet a tour group. And because of that we missed the first part which was disappointing.

review.title: Valentine Trip
review.reviewText: Outstanding staff, especially the door man.  Very polite, respectful and great at directions.  Check in and out was very easy.  Great location, cable cars stop right on the corner.  Easy walk to Union Square shopping, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf.  Excellent cafe right out the door serving fresh local fare.  Will stay here next time were in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort, friendly and knowledgeable staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Put coffee makers in the rooms or at least the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, cable cars, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf, views.

review.title: Wonderful hotel but no coffee!
review.reviewText: I would have given Orchard a 5 star rating if it wasn't for the fact that there was no coffee in the rooms or available in the lobby.  That is a very important amenity to me that I had taken for a given in all hotels and it was a rough way to greet the business day!

review.title: Business Stay needed something in Union Square
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff, surprised at spacious bath and room, clean and not too dated.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker in room would have been nice. But I did manage to get coffee in the lobby but had to pay $3 for it.  If a guest, should be complimentary.

review.title: Unexpected Excellence
review.reviewText: Modest appearance, small lobby.  Rooms lovely, spacioys, and well kept.  Staff very helpful.  Would definitely stay again. Make sure taxi drops you off at the correct Orchard@Bush&Powell. The other one (Orchard Garden) is on same street down the hill. Looks perfectly fine, but taxi dropped me off there, and I had to walk UP the hill with luggage to get to the right one.

review.title: Stay
review.reviewText: It was our first time at San Francisco, we booked our accommodation through Expedia...we had a wonderful experience at the orchard hotel, rooms were clean, staff were friendly and helpful.  If we visited SFO again we will definitely come back to this hotel.

review.title: Well located and comfortable SF Hotel
review.reviewText:
We arrived very early due to a change in flights and our room was not ready yet, so we checked our bags and had brunch at a local diner recommended by the concierge (which was great).  They had a room ready for us not long after and we checked in ahead of time.

The room itself was comfortable with everything you need and didn't feel at all cramped despite the smaller size typical of San Francisco hotels.  The walk up the hill from Union Square was a little steep but nothing to be put off by, being only minutes away from the heart of SF was great and a perfect location for our trip.  

The staff were pleasent and helpful which made for a great stay
review.positiveRemarks: Good central location, well featured rooms, clean and tidy.
review.negativeRemarks: No laundry on site however there is a coin laundry just a block away.
review.locationRemarks: Being right in the heart of SF there is so much to do! The Cable car runs right past, Union Square and Market St transport and shopping minutes away.

review.title: Nice Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice cozy hotel in a great location within walking distance to many restaurants and cafe's.  Room was comfortable but could have used a more plush chair for reading.  Having a car is expensive due to the cost of parking and we'd probably forego having one next time and instead rely on Google Maps and public transportation, which is readily available all around the hotel.  We would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Room chairs could be more plush.
review.locationRemarks: Location is right near or along major public transportation routes and is within walking distance of great restaurants, shopping and breakfast cafe's.

review.title: Good location, spacious room, friendly staff
review.reviewText:
This is a nice hotel with a good location a couple of blocks away from Union Square.  The rooms are actually very spacious for the area.  I would guess my room was around 300 square feet - I've stayed at much smaller rooms in the area.

There's also valet parking for $48/night - but you shouldn't need a car unless you need to drive out of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, spacious room, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel overall was not as new and modern as some of the trendier hotels, but that's fine.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square shopping, Chinatown

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, a little run down, not sure if it felt like a 3.5 star hotel. Wifi worked perfectly!
review.negativeRemarks: Update fabrics and carpets

review.title: Close and well positioned
review.reviewText:
The hotel was within walking distance to most areas, China Town, Union Square, Cable car stop. The staff were helpful and professional, the hotel was clean, maid service was very good and the rooms were a good size.
Only point to note was Bush Street is fairly busy/noisy therefore on our next visit we will request a higher floor room, (4th floor upwards)
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stop close, walking distance to Union Square, China Town and BART.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located with plenty of restaurants nearby, and the cable car right on your doorstep.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location, great staff!  Would stay again

review.title: Overbooking and sleazy management
review.reviewText: The hotel overbooked many customers and forced us to move to a cheaper and far hotel in one of the most uncomfortable areas in SF. It absolutely NOT worth paying the same lodging fee. Additionally, I had to use cabs for my business spending extra trip cost because of its inconvenient location. I am just angry.
Excellent hotel, superb location, friendly staff in a great city!
We had since time in sfo for the holiday weekend. Nice hotel, lobby, staff, convenient to union square. Valet parking available.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, perfect location, friendly staff, comfy bed. Would recommend this hotel to anybody.
I have stayed there twice and would stay there again.  Great location, good accommodations, great staff, good overall value.

review.title: Great location, great meeting facilities.
review.reviewText: Comfortable rooms, great staff,  great location.  All made for a perfect meeting location for global clients.

review.title: Its fine, nothing special though.
review.reviewText: Not bad, not great either.  Didn't realise it was  up the hill.  Arriving,  We walked from the bart station  and carried our luggage up the hill to the hotel, that wasn't too  fun.

review.title: "Big Monster"
review.reviewText:
We were there during a storm, power was out along entire street. No power in room, but generator powered the lobby.

Hard as the door man tried, couldn't get us a cab, we tipped him anyway.

Wish we could have had a better experience, but the hotel staff was as graceful as they could be.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was wonderful, location great.
review.negativeRemarks: This is a beautiful hotel.
review.locationRemarks: In good weather, it's close to shopping, and Bart. The Café next door has a lovely breakfast and staff. They lost power too and continued to serve.

review.title: Orchard San Francisco
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, with a terrific San Fran location.  About 30 minute walk to the Piers, through Chinatown and parts of Little Italy, which made the walk fascinating.  Good restaurants very near hotel, about a 10 minute walk to the BART line, making their no need for a car.  We also walked to a bike rental shop and rode over the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito, riding back on the ferry.  That was a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: Very professional staff, and comfortable setting.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows.  Down at these prices a must.  Also, would have loved a hot tub, but probably no where to put one at this point.
review.locationRemarks: Did that above.

review.title: Lovely, quiet hotel in awesome location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is on Bush St, just a few steps from the corner of Powell.  The cable cars stop right at that corner (so fun!) or it's a very short walk down to Union Square and all the awesome shopping and restaurants.  Couldn't be a better location.  Also a short walk to Chinatown.  
Even though it is close to everything, our room was very quiet.  The king bed was wonderful, comfortable pillows and bedding.  Very clean.   Very friendly staff.  Doorman was happy to hail us a cab when needed. 
We loved staying here and will stay again next time we visit San Francisco!
review.positiveRemarks: great location, quiet room, comfortable bed, large bathroom, friendly staff (including doorman)
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square - shopping, dining
Chinatown
Cable car to Fisherman's Wharf area & Pier 39

review.title: Class Act
review.reviewText: The Orchard appears to have been recently re-done - the room was immaculate, the public spaces are nicely designed - and yet it has maintained an old world charm and amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Chinatown, financial district, Market Street, Grace Cathedral, great restaurants, etc. Great spot.

review.title: Quiet, believe it or not in downtown SF!
review.reviewText: Quiet, clean and well located just 2 blocks from Union Square. Fast check in and we were greeted every time we entered and left the hotel. Will go back again, definitely.

review.title: Great location and clean rooms but poor staff
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice hotel - rooms are clean and spacious. Location of the hotel is very nice - only a few blocks from the union square. You can also walk to fishermen's wharf in 35 minutes or hop on the cable car which is right outside the hotel.

My only problem is with the  front desk staff. My luggage was delayed and was to be delivered by AA to the hotel. I informed the front desk about this when I checked in. The next day morning I really needed my luggage and spoke with someone from the front desk again to inquire about it. When my luggage did not arrive I called AA and learned that it was already delivered to the hotel the night before but no one had bothered to bring it up to the room or to let me know. They would put up a smile and greet you every time you come back to the hotel but they are not keen on doing what matters to you.
review.negativeRemarks: More responsible staff

review.title: Very nice Hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: Well worth the stay. I spent a week here for business and have no complaints. The staff are very helpful and accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and large room. Very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: OK as is.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car right out the door. Great cafe right outside the door as well.

review.title: Perfectly located
review.reviewText: Nice staff, well trained, old hotel but the room was clean, bathroom was recently upgraded.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, just steps away from Cable car Powell station, three blocks away from Union Square, 2 blocks away  from China Town.
review.negativeRemarks: Renovation on the common areas and restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: everything you can do in SF is close from this hotel.

review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice and clean.  The walk up the hill each night was a bit much.  I found it easiest to take BART to the Powell station and it's a straight walk up Powell St to the hotel.

review.title: Great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice small hotel. Staff was excellent, and rooms were very pleasant and comfortable. Dining options not great, but you're in San Francisco....hundreds of great places to eat within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in your room.
review.locationRemarks: Trolley right outside. Union Square 2 blocks away. Market and financial districts only blocks away.

review.title: Cable car stop right there
review.reviewText: Great location.  Transportation and good restaurants close by.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: This small hotel is close to Union Square and the main bus transit points in Market Street so we found it extremely easy to use our three day visitor bus pass to go in all directions.  The room was clean and while not huge, it was a comfortable size. The staff is extremely helpful. The only negative was that as it is a small hotel, there are not many other facilities.

review.title: Nice hotel close to amenities
review.reviewText: We had a great stay over the Halloween weekend.  Staff was courteous and very helpful. The hotel os very close to shopping and great restaurants We will definitely stay here again.
excellent location just two blocks north of Union Square; staff very helpful; quiet, clean; bed extremely comfortable

review.title: Just what we wanted
review.reviewText: So glad we booked this smaller boutique hotel. The staff was efficient and friendly. Our 9th floor king room was quiet, clean,  comfy and beautifully furnished. Great shower and products. We hopped on a cable car 25 yards from the front door. Close enough to Union Square action, but in a quieter location. We'd stay again!

review.title: Great location. Very close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Room was extremely clean. Staff were incredibly helpful.
The location was veriy convenient.  The staff was very friendly,
review.negativeRemarks: The room cleaned before 5 p.m.

review.title: Just what we were looking for.
review.reviewText:
In SF for the first time to see the sights.

Great location close to Chinatown, Union Square, the Financial District and the Embarcadero -  friendly and helpful staff - nice room - what's not to like?
review.negativeRemarks: No coffee maker in room (fortunately it was available right next door) and the temp in the room was hard to regulate.

review.title: Great location and comfy room!
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is in a great location for exploring San Francisco.  We walked through Chinatown, through North Beach and down to the Embarcadero.  Staff was very welcoming and helpful.  Rooms were pleasant and we enjoyed our stay.  Would definitely come back when visiting SF.
review.positiveRemarks: location, lobby, nice rooms, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: a few carpet spots
review.locationRemarks: Close to the cable cars, walking distance to Chinatown and information center.  There's anything and everything around you on Bush and Powell.

review.title: Great little hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Upon arriving, I was a bit disappointed at the lobby, but once I got to my room, my concerns were allayed. The lobby was small and unremarkable, but the room was spacious, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Moreover, the dining room was very nice and breakfast was great. Most of all, the staff was fantastic. They knew where everything was and how to get there. They helped us get a black car to the airport at an ungodly hour, for less than a taxi. Great place to stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Uninspiring lobby
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area, downtown near everything

review.title: Small hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 3 night stay in this well located, small hotel. The room was modern, roomy and well appointed with tasteful decor. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The main negative was the high cost of parking our car (143 USD for 3 days).
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable, modern, well appointed hotel with helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Information on convenient, alternative self park locations as an alternative to the hotel's valet parking service
review.locationRemarks: Convenient street location for bars, restraunts & shops. Close to Chinatown and Big Bus tour stop. Physically fit can walk to many locations.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel was wonderful.
The location is great. Just a short walk to everything and a 10 dollar cab ride to the fisherman s warf. The staff was extremely helpful and our tour picked us up right at the front doors.
Only thing we were the youngest people there by at least 10 years. Seemed more catered to older people.
Still had a wonderful time I would recommend to anyone

review.title: Orchard review
review.reviewText: Great location, great beds, clean room, POOR Shower heads.  For the price I expect some type of water pressure

review.title: Very nice stay at the Orchard Hotel.
review.reviewText: A great location for exploring San Francisco, just a short walk from Union Square and tourist sights. Comfortable room, friendly staff, ideal for a couple of nights. Valet service available but seemed a little expensive at $42 a day but convenient all the same. Nice stay.

review.title: Great Location - Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Best two places to stay in SF = Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square.  The Orchard is 2 minutes walk from the centre of Union Square shopping district and 10 minute ($15 taxi) to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39.  Excellent location, friendly and helpful staff and clean and comfortable rooms.  Worth every penny!
review.negativeRemarks: No bath, but shower was huge and good.

review.title: Great Week at The Orchard Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
From the moment we arrived at The Orchard Hotel, the staff was extremely concerned with our satisfaction. Our room, while not particularly large, was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was also really nice, with top notch toiletries and towels. Virtually every staff person we encountered was eager to help us however possible. The hotel is also in a great location in the city and accessible to all major San 
Francisco attractions. Finally, though, I would like to acknowledge the fact that the front desk staff of the hotel went above and beyond to assist me when I experienced some health issues at the end of my stay. Great service and comfortable rooms are what you can expect at The Orchard Hotel!

review.title: Peaceful, tasteful, and reliable
review.reviewText: An excellent choice in all ways. Quiet tasteful rooms, perfectly maintained, convenient to Chinatown, Union Square shopping, Nob Hill. Nothing jarring or out of place. Priced fairly. Friendly helpful staff. Best of all, the beds. I never wanted to get up!
review.negativeRemarks: More diverse breakfast choices.

review.title: Good position.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very centrally positioned, easy for transport by cable car and bus.  The room was good value and the staff very helpful.  We would have liked to be able to have evening meals at the hotel, but the restaurant was not operating whilst we were staying there.  Overall, it will be a prime consideration for my next visit to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant should serve light evening meals as there are limited restaurants for supper in the area.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and cable car stops.  Quite good shopping in the area.

review.title: Perfect location and perfect hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms spacious, most comfortable beds, close to amenities, perfect location.
review.negativeRemarks: Just view from window
review.locationRemarks: Near union square. Close to bus for fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Nice, small hotel with a family feel
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, just up from union square.  It had excellent links from the airport and was very close to a cable car stop.  It was a great base from which to visit all of the major attractions in and around San Francisco. The staff were all very helpful and keen to assist.
review.locationRemarks: Being just a few blocks from union square the transport links were excellent and it was close to good places to eat.

review.title: Quality hotel in the middle of down-town SF.
review.reviewText: This is a superb hotel right in the middle of down-town San Francisco; approx $50 cab ride from SF international airport. Just fifteen yards from the hotel entrance is a stop for the Powell & Hyde cable car which is a great way to get around SF; especially to get to Fisherman's Wharf area. There are several restaurants and coffee shops within a few minutes walk from the hotel. The room we had was well appointed, well maintained and clean. The staff were lovely; attentive, helpful and friendly. Both of the concierges we dealt with went out of their way to be helpful. We breakfasted in the hotel restaurant on the two nights we stayed and the food was excellent and reasonably priced. If you get the opportunity, definitely go to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge, eat at "Wipe Out" (Pier 39), hire a bike and cycle to foot of Golden Gate Bridge, go on the Rocket Boat but get the last trip of the day, the boat is quieter, they want to burn fuel and the failing light makes it more atmospheric.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the rooms, the location. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate staying there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge. Eat at "Wipe Out" (Pier 39), hire a bike and cycle to foot of Golden Gate Bridge, Rocket Boat.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Great experience at the Orchard Hotel. Excellent location, very helpful staff. Clean room with good size. Would definitely recommend it, especially for first time visitors in SF.

review.title: Comfort in Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable, clean rooms. Staff was nice and attentive. definitely will stay there again, and i recommend you do too...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel situated a short walk from union square on a quieter Bush St. Good breakfast venue on the corner called Roxane cafe.
review.positiveRemarks: Very knowledgable staff. Valet parking cheaper than most hotels in the vicinity. Free wifi in all rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Well worth seeing the Giants play!

review.title: Orchard Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is a very clean oleder proprty, located adjacent to Union Square. The staff is friendly and well trained. The best choice for a Union Square located hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Union square - central SF location, close to extensive shopping & good restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: We stayed there on a Saturday night and would go there again. It's centrally located near Union Square, the staff is extremely polite and helpful and the room was nicely appointed and very clean. Room was small but it's the City - reminded me of older New York City hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Was pleased
review.locationRemarks: Great location and lots to do. Great place for out of towners to stay.

review.title: Fantastic stay!!
review.reviewText: Great location which is walking distance to public transportation options and good restaurants. Staff were very helpful and took the time to help us out with any questions we had.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel. Have stayed here many times and have found it more than comfortable each times. Rooms are a fabulous size and really clean.

review.title: Well positioned
review.reviewText: A small, friendly and well-positioned hotel in this trendy city. Close to shops, transport and a comfortable walk to the bay. Decoration demonstrated class and quality but not entirely to my taste - one very small mark down in a otherwise near perfect score. Will be back.
review.negativeRemarks: Style of decoration
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks only to the main shopping district and on a cable car line

review.title: Very nice hotel in downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
Hotel in downtown San Francisco close to everything.
The room was clean and nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel, the staff and the room.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Chinatown and Union square.

review.title: In San Francisco for the SF 1/2 Marathon.
review.reviewText: A quiet and comfortable hotel with a helpful and friendly staff. The location is not the closest to the start of the race but I was warmed up by the time I arrived at the start. A great place to stay and relax.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay here. I liked that it was a small hotel but still had a restaurant, fridge in room etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Small hotel near Union Square so very convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and good shopping nearby.

review.title: Reasonable location, small rooms
review.reviewText: There are better places to stay in San Francisco for the same price. Staff were polite and friendly, rooms were small and dark. Hard to recommend.

review.title: Very good Hotel near Union Sq.
review.reviewText: We had a great experience  at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Even the  housekeeping staff wished us a great day. The desk and concierge were very knowledgeable and helpful on how to get to attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel was older but our room was spacious and updated.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is 2 blocks from union square and very short walk to the Chinatown gate. Fairly steep hill to climb from Union Square. Just off cable car rt

review.title: Great find!
review.reviewText: Hotel was wonderful!  Big CLEAN rooms!  Very quiet and friendly doorman with great recommendations.  Awesome location!

review.title: We loved our stay in San Francisco at the Orchard!
review.reviewText: The staff was just outstanding, they went above and beyond to make our stay a great one!  The location was so convenient!
review.locationRemarks: Close to the cable car line, shopping and great restaurants near by the hotel!

review.title: Great place, smaller than I thought.
review.reviewText: My only negative is the size, a bit too small. Everything else was great. Very clean. Helpful staff. Great location. Near the trolly and Big Bus Tours route.  Great restaurants near by. My wife and I walked to and from Fishermans  Warf, not too far. Felt safe, even late at night.  I'd stay there again.

review.title: excellent hotel to stay in
review.reviewText: I choose hotels when vacationing based upon other customers rating/comments.  Thank-you previous guests!!!  The Orchard Hotel did not disappoint.  The staff gave us accurate directions to places of interest, booked tours for us, booked transportation to the airport, recommended restaurants and on and on.  The hotel itself was nicely decorated, room was large, there was a mini frig that was stocked with drinks, alcohol,  snacks. bathroom was huge [shower only or tub and shower were available], furnishings were updated, bed comfortable.   I knew that San Framcisco was built on many hills however I didn't realize how steep that the hills are.  For a person with mobility issues, cabs may be required to get from place to place.  San Francisco is a great vacation destination and the Orchard Hotel and staff certainly will maximize your enjoyment.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were quite large considering that we had a king size bed.  I t was right on the Powell Market trolley line.  Staff were extremely accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: The hours that the restaurant were open seemed alittle irregular for breakfast.  The food in the restaurant was very tasty if you chose to eat there.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Chinatown and Union Square.   Some excellent restaurants close by.  Uncle Vito's pizza and Lori's Diner were two lower cost good food .

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel close to Union square and the cable car stop. Big room, clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room and the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: I do not like carpet, so I will change the floor.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, close to the cable car stop, shopping, restaurants, convenient stores, pubs etc.

review.title: Great Location and great hotel !!
review.reviewText: The staff were very courteous and professional: answered all questions and were very helpful !

review.title: Close to cable cars
review.reviewText: quiet friendly hotel.easy to get to bus lines bart etc
review.negativeRemarks: some cleaning needs to be done;bathroom fans need to be installed
review.locationRemarks: everything-close to cable cars bus lines and restaurants

review.title: Well located and a very nice little hotel
review.reviewText: Was quite pleased with the room and staff. Found it was in a convenient location when deciding which touristy sights we wanted to take in. Room was clean, the bed comfortable and the bathroom spacious.

review.title: Great central location in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff were great, staff very accommodating.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a big smile by the bellman. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are very comfortable. The staff are always pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: We had issues with our toilet.Mentioned it to the front desk -it was looked at but never did work well. Dirty glasses were not picked up until day 3
review.locationRemarks: Location is convenient. Cable car at the corner, Walgreens and Starbucks a block away. City transit Close by. Restaurant at the corner.

review.title: Good downtown location
review.reviewText: View from my 9th floor window was not great (looking at another building's rooftop and air conditioner) and there was dumpster noise in the alley below at 2:45am which woke me up. Otherwise the room was pretty clean and my stay was good.

review.title: Wonderful stay and perfect location
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for 5 nights and it is a lovely boutique hotel which will keep you going back. As a solo traveller, I wanted a good location, clean rooms and a safe area. The Orchard Hotel exceeded all my expectations. The location is close to Union Square and all the shopping you could want, the cable car stop is steps from the hotel, turn right and Chinatown is a few minutes walk away, the staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the hotel was just far enough away from the busy area away from the crowds, feel safe and get a good nights rest. The rooms are a very good size, clean and very comfortable. I had a king bed on the 5th floor which was delightful and the bathroom was huge. A little bit of traffic noise, but you would expect that from the hills around the city.

I didn't have a car so the hotel was also perfectly located near bus stops that would get you anywhere around the city as the cable cars can get full pretty fast. The Dafodill restaurant in the hotel is very good, spacious and comfortable. It was nice to have breakfast and then go back to the room to get ready for the day.
I would definitely stay at the Orchard Hotel again, it is a wonderful hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Top of the Mark for martinis - there are 100 to choose from

review.title: Comfortable hotel with good location
review.reviewText: 2nd stay here. Great location. Friendly staff. Rooms not large but very comfortable. Would definitely come back

review.title: Great Stay at Orchard Hotel!
review.reviewText: My husband and I were absolutely satisfied with our choice of the Orchard Hotel, which we booked as part of an Expedia hotel/flight package for our three night stay in San Francisco over the Memorial Day weekend. It had every amenity needed to make our visit comfortable and pleasant, including exceptionally helpful and cheerful front desk, bell, and housekeeping staff; well-appointed rooms; excellent beds and linens; and a central location for exploring the city. Thank you, Orchard Hotel staff, for a great stay!

review.title: Convenient and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Perfect location and not on a busy street. However we can hear the cable cars at night.
review.locationRemarks: 2 short blocks to Union Square and upscale shopping. Lots of restaurants nearby.

review.title: great, convenient location
review.reviewText: great value, easy location, recommended - everything went according to plan. no hassles or complications
Good location and clean room. I like the healing music CD equipped in a room.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Didn't think much if this hotel. It's nothing pretty to look at from looking outside in. However, the beds are extremely soft, the bathroom is clean, and the location is great. Just a five minute walk from everywhere you need to shop downtown. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will have future visits

review.title: Clean and comfortable business trip.
review.reviewText: Room was great. All was clean. Cardio Room was a bit of a let down, but great stay overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Cardio Room
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to everything I personally needed to get to (Mission St. businesses, etc).

review.title: Perfect location and clean
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel it is small but very clean and convenient since I was traveling with my 13 month old baby.... Walgreens is like a 5 min walk . .. Very close to Bart and union square

review.title: Fantastic trip.
review.reviewText:
Wonderful trip to San Francisco. Hotel was Fantastic. Close to everything. Bring your walking shoes and a sweater and enjoy. We walked and walked. Rented a car a couple of days for business, but if hanging out
in the city take the muni or cable cars or walk. Got to see the Giants and the Dodgers play.
The Orchard is wonderful the hotel staff fantastic I recommend this hotel. It got five stars from us.
review.locationRemarks: China town, union square, att stadium, so much more. Fantastic places to eat.

review.title: great hotel close to city
review.reviewText: we found the staff very helpful. It was close to transportation & restaurants.
review.locationRemarks: great location Lots to see nearby

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Stayed five nights, good location very accommodating staff. Minimum amenities, good breakfast but pricey. Noise level acceptable.

review.title: Outstanding service at wonderful boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel at a great location just off Union Square. The service was personal and attentive. The bellman were genuinely interested in assisting my needs. I had a nice suite that well appointed and very comfortable. The price was quite a bit less than a postage stamp in hotels a block away.
review.positiveRemarks: The great service and value for very nice Accommodations.
review.locationRemarks: Best location in San Francisco. A short block or so to Union Square.

review.title: Very good location/friendly staff
review.reviewText: Orchard is a very well located hotel. Room and bathroom are quiet roomy and comfortable. Bed is excellent. The only drawback would be the limited-hours dining service. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Recommend it.
review.reviewText:
Coming from a city where hotel rooms can be shamefully small, The Orchard room size impressed us, since it is in Union Square/Chinatown - a packed part of San Francisco, and offered a neat boutique feel. Fellow patrons were quiet and respectable.

Positives: Stayed in King suite; super comfortable beds, big bathroom, very clean room, staff was very friendly/knowledgeable and could tell us exactly where to walk/run and eat out; easy location; great running, shopping, cafes surrounding the Orchard.

Negative: Lacked good views (from our room on the 3rd floor of 5).

review.title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Stayed for Business, very accommodating. Enjoyed how close we were to Union Square. 10 min walk from Moscone Center. Quick Cab rides every where else.

review.title: Very friendly and clean hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the stay in the hotel very much. It was a relief after one night in another hotel in the center of San Francisco which had been real nightmare. Everything was clean, beds were very comfortable and it was very quiet in the room. There was also decent complimentary WiFi Internet (one of the reasons why we chose the hotel). The stuff was very friendly and professional. I'd recommend it to anybody.
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi Internet was decent but there were times when it was very slow and it happened once or twice that it was accessible at all.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Aside from the location, this was a let down - the restaurant is not open on Sunday or Monday; a bar that closes at 9pm; and, room service consists of just 3 items (only available when the restaurant is open)! Poor...
review.negativeRemarks: Services should be available 7 days a week.

review.title: great location and fantastic staff
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was always ready to talk to you and ask about your day to recommend any deals or suggestions
review.locationRemarks: you can hop right on the cable car. Walk down to Union Square, close to walk up to amazing Nob hill. Nice restaurants super close by

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText:
Fantastic customer service received from ALL staff! Thank you! I will be back!

Kind regards,

Beatrice

review.title: Pleasant Stay at the Orchard
review.reviewText: From the time we stepped in to the minute we left, we felt welcomed and appreciated for our business. The front desk and staff went out of their way to offer suggestions for excursions, to offer help for transportation, dining, etc..
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent customer service, clean, tidy, professional
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of anything
review.locationRemarks: Two block walk to Union Square, the shopping district, with many restaurants to choose from. Bus tours also frequently stop at this location.

review.title: Very clean, quiet hotel in the French quarter.
review.reviewText: Stayed here four nights for a conference. The room was very clean, comfortable. Location is excellent—just a couple blocks north of Union Square. Friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: If you're looking for a gym or good exercise facilities, look elsewhere. Their "cardio" room is simply a hotel room with a couple treadmills and a TV.
review.locationRemarks: Very good restaurants within 1-2 blocks.

review.title: nice stay
