review.reviewText: All good. The only downer was the garbage truck banging the dumpster below our backside room at 3 in the morning. Not much you can do about that.

review.title: Great Reasonable SF Hotel Near Union Square
review.reviewText:
The Orchard Hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The location is very good. Just a couple of blocks up from Union Square on Bush between Powell and Pine. An easy walk up the hill two blocks to the Mark and Fairmont if you want to go for a nice drink. Chinatown is totally within walking distance and it's really just a fifteen minute walk down to Market Street and Nordstrom and all the other shops in an amazing shopping center.

The hotel itself is very nice. It's comfortable, clean and feels very up to date. The double room we had was very spacious and pleasant. The service was great and the staff very friendly and helpful and nothing intimidating as in the higher end hotels. Our experience at the orchard was great and if you go at a time when there are no conventions the price is rally great. $279 per night. We would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: small hotel feel, very friendly and helpful staff both morning and night. I don't know how old this hotel is but it seems very fresh and new.
review.negativeRemarks: It had everything we needed except first run movies on the TV. They do have some dated DVDs you can borrow but not much you'd want to see. minor
review.locationRemarks: As I said above it is pretty much close to everything. Definitely within walking distance for Union Square, chinatown, nob hill, Market Street etc.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very friendly hotel staff with excellent facilities. Especially comfortable beds. Try the breakfast blueberry pancakes - they were delicious

review.title: Nice hotel on Nob Hill, nice walk to ferry buildin
review.reviewText: Nice staff, clean and spacious room, wonderful large bathroom, and sitting area.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: As noted above in my comment

review.title: nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Everybody took such good care of us. The staff was pleasant and went out of their way to help with directions and anything else we wanted.
review.negativeRemarks: I think first thing in the morning, coffee should be free for hotel guests.
review.locationRemarks: Buy a muni pass and you can go anywhere from this location

review.title: Excellent location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was situated only two blocks down from Union Square and the trams were at end of street one way and the gates of China Town at the other end.

review.title: Very nice hotel and staff in good area.
review.reviewText: The hotel was just a short walk from union square and all the great shopping, and just blocks from Chinatown. Staff was great and very helpful, rooms where clean and nice. King size bed was like sleeping at home very very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Later room service.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, knob hill, BART stations, trolley drops you off right on the corner.

review.title: Very good, well-priced, centrally-located hotel
review.reviewText:
The Orchard is a good, centrally-located four-star hotel at a reasonable price. The staff are friendly, helpful and respectful. We especially appreciated Cornell's assistance, both before we arrived and during our stay. The rooms are attractive and comfortable. The location is excellent. It's only about 10 m down from the corner of Bush and Powell Streets. Walk down Powell and you are at Union Square in a few minutes and the cable car terminus at Market Street in five to 10 minutes. Going the other way on Powell (a steep uphill climb!), you're at Nob Hill after just two blocks. Chinatown is about three blocks down Bush. My wife and I also walked from the hotel to the Bay, Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Coit Tower, Lombard Street and other places of interest on a number of occasions. However, those trips take more time and may be difficult if one is not especially fit (San Fran is very hilly).

All in all, we had a really great time in San Francisco and were glad of our accommodation at the Orchard.
review.negativeRemarks: The only petty annoyance we had was having to log in every time we wanted to avail ourselves of the free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Awesome Location with character
review.reviewText:
Loved this hotel but I must admit that San Francisco was my favourite place that we visited on this trip - such a pretty city. I thought it was a little bit dated when I first arrived but I ended up loving it - character I call it. Room was a great size, bathroom was great, comfy bed - it was all good.

Parking was expensive - we only had it for one night because we arrived late,

You don't need a car in San fran. Use the hop on hop off bus - awesome!!!

Location of hotel was unreal although take your walking shoes with all those hills - great exercise!

Restaurants everywhere, we didn't eat in the hotel but an awesome cafe just on the corner - literally steps away.

I highly recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Hop on hop off bus Alcatraz Fishermans wharf Gold Gate bridge - we walked there and back - it was awesome.

review.title: nice hotel, quiet location, on cable car line
review.reviewText: very good position, close enough to union square but quiet for sleeping, cable cars stop just up from the front of the hotel making access to union square and fishermans wharf and pier 39 very easy. very helpful staff and always friendly
review.positiveRemarks: close proximity to everything, comfortable beds , quiet, clean and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing everything was good.
review.locationRemarks: Good location close to union square, cable car to fishermans wharf, pier 39, alcatraz and golden gate bridge

review.title: Small hotel tucked into great downtown location
review.reviewText: Very good location within walking distance of everything downtown. Friendly, very helpful and courteous staff. Big quiet rooms with all the amenities. Very good value for money!
review.locationRemarks: Around corner from great restaurants, cable car and shopping. Because the city is so compact, a real kaleidoscope of interesting people everywhere!

review.title: Charming Boutiique
review.reviewText: The Orchard is an attractive and comfortable boutique hotel with very solicitous emplees. Oriental decor adds to the public spaces. The dining and drinking facilities are pleasant, and although the food is expensive it is worth the money.. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the way the employees offered their help without even being asked. The guests got much personal attention.
review.negativeRemarks: I thought the carpeting could be much cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is around the corner from the cable cars--convenient but a little noisy at night. Many nice restaurants operate nearby.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel. We had a room with a king size bed and a very spacious bath.
review.positiveRemarks: This is a nice quite boutique hotel near Union Square, China Town, The Warf and many other attractions. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area. One p
review.locationRemarks: Locations is perfect! Plenty of restaurants, stores, and sights close by with many within walking distance.

review.title: close to Union square, ChinaTown, restaurants etc.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfortable bed and the staff aimed to please.

review.title: Great Service, Great Room, Great Location!
review.reviewText: Great Location the Orchard Hotel is two blocks from Union Square and about a 20 minute walk to Moscone Center. The rooms are very comfortable, clean and accommodating staff. Each room has a mini frig so you can have a few snacks in the room, in room coffee. The beds are really good and the rooms are quite spacious for a city hotel with a desk to do some work. Staff are great and very helpful, doorman to help with taxi and/or transportation when needed. Felt very safe in this hotel and several very good restaurants within just a few blocks-Highly Recommend this Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I would love to see Morning Coffee available in the lobby that is brewed for guests and not just small 1 cup coffee pots in the room.

review.reviewText: The Hotel is well located with large clean rooms. The staff were friendly and always available but not overbearing. We'd highly recommend it.

review.title: Good choice in San Francisco
review.reviewText: For San Francisco, the price was quite reasonable. The location is great, a couple of blocks from Chinatown and Union Square. Our room on the third floor was quiet and comfortable. The bathroom is large and nicely appointed. The staff was friendly and kind. Our only complaint is that the housekeepers could have been more attentive, but we would stay in the Orchard Hotel again.

I understand it is not always easy for hotels to cater to everyone's needs but, until this point, and without exception, hotels have always catered for my allergy to feather and down bedding. Before my stay I contacted the hotel asking for special bedding, I booked an allergy friendly room and was confident all would be well. I was not checked into the allergy room I had booked, and was given a room with feather bedding. When I queried this with the desk I was offered an upgrade to an allergy room at additional cost (which was provided when I suggested I had already paid for this) and was assured this would be free from feather and down. After a very uncomfortable two nights it was clear that this was not the case. I requested a change in bedding and this was provided but it still appeared to contain feather and down - 48 hours later and I still have swollen eyes, require medication and look terrible. The location is great, I can't vouch for the restaurant as it was not apparently open during our stay, the cardio room is a joke and I had no success with the provision of appropriate bedding.
review.negativeRemarks: See above, the hotel needs to get the basics of customer service worked out.

review.title: Excellent Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: Had a very enjoyable time here last weekend. Great room, very nice and comfortable. The restaurant has great food and our service was great. Staff was very helpful and friendly. All and all an excellent place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable bed, clean room, the room was a nice place to be.

review.locationRemarks: Location excellent

review.title: Easily accessible to points of interest
review.positiveRemarks: nice size rooms, clean, staff really helpful

review.title: Fantastic staff! Would definitely stay again.
review.reviewText:
My wife and myself have stayed in many large hotel chains and boutique hotels. This one by far had the friendliest staff, I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. The rooms were very clean and cozy.

If you are looking for an overall pleasant stay in the San Francisco (Union Square ) area, this is the place. Very easy access to every which way just off the beaten path.

review.negativeRemarks: It feels old, especially the hallways.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Quick trip to SF
review.reviewText: Only a one night stay but I was impressed. The hotel is clean and close to Union Square which is where I wanted to be. My room, particularly the bathroom, was spacious and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Only a couple of minutes to get a taxi to go to/from my business meetings.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very good. Hotel location, space and cleanliness was very good.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square.

review.title: nice hotel close to the shops
review.reviewText: after reading some reviews i was expecting an old slightly run down hotel but in reality it's an old building with modern appliances/touches and some antique-like room furniture. brilliant location for shopping, china town and eating out. 40 min ish walk from fisherman's wharf (the nearby traditional tram was always full). staff were very pleasant and helpful. all in all I would definitely recommend this hotel

review.negativeRemarks: The room temperature was hard to control, I wish we could have opened the windows. Bathtub was a little dirty and I had to reconnect the toilet chain

review.title: Very nice location.
review.reviewText: The staff in this hotel were great. They tried so hard to help us with our noise issues. They were always helpful with recommendations for restaurants and how to use public transportation. The hotel was always clean and neat and really looked good for a building as old as it is. There are lots of options for restaurants very close by.
review.negativeRemarks: There is a never-ending groan of streetcar cables which run about 50 yards from the corner of the building. It wouldn't bother everyone...but did us.
review.locationRemarks: This is a great location for sight seers...you can walk to the piers, to the ferry dock, Union Square, China Town, even Ghiradelli Square!

review.title: Great location, nice and cozy
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference in a nearby hotel. The location is great - a couple blocks from union square and china town. The price was reasonable and the rooms were spacious and clean. The only strange thing was that housekeeping kept coming multiple times throughout the day. Unless you put out the "do not disturb" sign, they will come as early as 8:30am. During my stay, my room was cleaned once during the day and again in the evening. Besides the excess housekeeping, my overall experience was great and I would stay here again.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Deluxe King room was comfortable with a spacious bathroom and good storage. Bed was excellent as was the large bedside cabinet with extending shelf and sufficient power sockets for charging cell phones, tablets and laptops. Room servicing was was good with supplies replenished promptly. As a single traveller I felt safe and secure at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Perfectly situated to access all of San Francisco's many places of interest. Hotel staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: I requested a quiet room but was not warned about the background noise from the nearby Powell Street cable car - maybe tripple glazing would help.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square, two blocks from Chinatown, Grace cathedral and Cable Car museum a 10 min walk, Ferry Building and Embarcadero 15 min.

review.reviewText: This was our first time staying in San Francisco and it was amazing. The hotel was very nice and the staff was excellent. The rooms were very clean and the location was great. We will definitely stay there again when we return.

review.title: very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
The location is very convenient with a
Starbucks, Walgreens and comfortable restaurants and diners within a block or two. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room felt plush with a very comfortable bed and fresh pillows and linen. Large 37" hi-def tv was a very pleasant surprise. The bathroom and shower was roomy and well equipped. We'll definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, comfortable room and bed.
review.locationRemarks: Just a two minute walk to Union Square. Going uphill may be a challenge for some. One block away from a Starbucks, a Walgreens and good restaurants.

review.title: Quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: A peaceful place, elegant and relaxed. Simple and easy. The rooms were clean and the hotel is well kept. The staff was helpful and not pushy.

review.title: Centrally licated
review.reviewText:
Use the cable car to get up the hill.
Plenty nice restaurants & bars close to walk to.

review.title: Great hotel, not one of the big chains.
review.reviewText: Great boutique hotel. Small but helpful staff always willing to spend time giving directions and advice. Located two blocks from Union Square and China Town. Half a block to the Powell-Mason cable car stop. Lots of shopping and restaurants for every budget and taste within a few blocks. The room was large and clean. The beds were very comfortable. Would definitely go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was really nice for the price. I would rate it up there with some of the big chain Marriots, Hyatts and Hiltons. Just don't expect a grand entry.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked a faster internet connection, but it was free and simple to access.

review.title: Nice hotel with a friendly feel about it.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. It is a fifteen minute walk to downtown which we enjoyed but a hotel shuttle is available if you prefer. After a few days we discovered several restaurants close by but ate at the restaurant downstairs from the hotel on two nights and enjoyed the food.
review.positiveRemarks: It had a nice friendly feel about it.
review.negativeRemarks: It was a bit unnerving at first to see several homeless people in the area.

review.title: Bad start, nice recovery
review.reviewText:
My wife and I checked in at about 12:30 (after the check-out) time but our room wasn't ready. Upon our return at around 6:30, they informed us that the previous guest fell ill and needed to stay an extra night and that the no other rooms with king beds were available, so they'd be putting us up in a room with two twin beds for the night. They didn't offer any sort of compensation for the mishap, but I told them they needed to make amends somehow and that I wanted to speak with the manager. I didn't (and still don't) understand why they didn't know when we checked-in that someone was still in our room as of 12:30, when check-out is at noon.

While I was upset about the mishap, the hotel definitely made up for things in the long run. Shortly thereafter, they called us in the room and told us that we'd been upgraded to the King Suite, where we ended up staying for the duration of the trip. They refused to take a tip for bring our bags to the room because of the misunderstanding. We even had a package shipped directly to the hotel because we had forgotten my wife's bridesmaid dress back home. But for the rest of the stay, the staff was very jovial and helpful.

The room itself was very dated though. The carpets are definitely worn down, the furniture is chipped, and the bedding, while clean, needs to be replaced (our sheets were torn in spots). I doubt I would pay full price for the hotel (we got a discount through Expedia), but I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location. Plus the staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor, the carpet, the bedding, etc. Just very dated overall.

review.title: Good hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Bar facility and provision of more coffee sachets
review.locationRemarks: Good central location

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText:
The staff at this hotel are 100% devoted to top customer service--from the concierge and bell staff to the reception and housekeeping staff.

The location is on the corner of Bush and Powell--if you want a cable car, just walk out the door to Powell. I walked all over downtown from here and it's a quick cab to the waterfront; North Beach, Japan Town and more.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff; the beautiful and well stocked room.
review.locationRemarks: Cafe de la Presse; Market Street; department stores like Saks; Union Square; Chinatown are all within walking distance--hilly but doable walk.

review.title: A gem of a hotel
review.reviewText: The Orchard is an intimate hotel compared to the "chains" but really is close to perfect. It is well situated near downtown and the iconic SF cable car runs steps from the front door. Each and every staff member we spoke with, from the bellmen to the front desk staff to the cleaning staff, were welcoming and enthusiastic. The room was very well laid out and kept spotlessly clean throuout the stay. The bathroom was a delight - large and very well lit which any fellow whose tried to shave in an "artfully designed" bathroom will appreciate. The bed was heaven and easily the most comfortable hotel bed I've had in a decade. The only flaw: there is quite a bit of traffic noise and a little room to room noise. A light sleeper like me, without a white noise generator as I use, might find sleeping difficult. But its the single flaw that makes a perfect diamond.

review.title: Well run and managed and well located near Nob Hil
review.reviewText: We know SFO well. Everything is expensive! Great city. Orchard is good value

review.title: Orchard Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: The stay was very pleasant, and the location is ideal for the cable cars, Union Square, and China Town (2 blocks away downhill). There is no doubt that we would stay at the Orchard Hotel again. There was a great breakfast dinner next to the hotel Roxann's. Great pizza place diagonally across the street Uncle Vito's.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, courteous staff, and very clean. Staff helped with anything you asked, if they could not, they found someone who could.
review.negativeRemarks: Without nit picking...Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Chinatown, cable cars. All just a couple of minutes away.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week here. Good location for everything. Cable cars are a bit of a nightmare to get to fishermans wharf. Hotel is clean and modern. Didn't try the restaurant, it always seemed very quiet. Menu looked expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Restuarant offers

review.title: Close to the city
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the hotel and would stay there again. Everyone was so nice and helpful. Gave us ideas where to go in San Francisco and how to get there. The hotel had parking which was more expensive so we chose to park at another garage. The hotel was in the City so prepare to walk a lot. Thank you for your recommendation.
review.positiveRemarks: Felt comfortable there. Always said hello and good by when you left.
review.negativeRemarks: Better wifi, microwave, vending machines soda machines
review.locationRemarks: Lots of things to do once you hop on a bus or trolley

review.title: Great Orchard Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice clean hotel. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are quiet. The Orchard is located just a couple of blocks away from China Town. There are many shops and restaurants nearby within walking distance of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price. I got this hotel for a good price on Expedia.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, sightseeing and restaurants. There is plenty to do nearby.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to SF. I am so happy I chose to stay at the Orchard. It was near Chinatown, Union Square, Little Italy.... The staff was very nice. I highly recommend this hotel. I will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The proximity to many great neighborhoods, the accommodating staff, the lovely rooms, everything!
review.negativeRemarks: No improvements needed.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Had a very good experience at the orchard hotel. Clean rooms,big bathroom, nice TV, and friendly staff. Definetly recommend for anyone who is not familiar with San Francisco. Plenty of transportation nearby. Great stay.

review.title: Very nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I and a few other friends stayed here in August, we were in town to follow the Boston Red Sox who were playing the San Francisco Giants. The hotel is at the mid-point of a one of San Fran's giant hills but just a short walk from many attractions, including Union Square and the gate to Chinatown. Very pleasant staff with tips about getting around and how to get to other attractions not in walking distance. The trolley runs right on the cross street next to the hotel if you want to take it.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't eat in the hotel restaurant, way overpriced! Not much of an exercise room, just 3 cardio machines in a vacant guest room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown Gate, trolley

review.title: Good value boutique hotel in central location
review.reviewText: It was a nice little hotel close to Chinatown and Union Square. Wifi didnt work too well at times, but this may not have been the hotels fault as many outlets close by had the same issue. Overall a good hotel and I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi

review.title: Can't Wait to Come Back!
review.reviewText: Very clean! Friendly staff. 2 blocks from union square which is perfect. It was just enough distance to keep the noise down at night but close enough to walk!
review.positiveRemarks: Insomnia Book and CD, music player with speaker
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful! So close to everything!

review.title: Orchard Hotel Tourist Review
review.reviewText: Good location--right on cable car line, 2 blocks from Union Square, and 2 blocks from bus line to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was very professional and helpful. We would definitely stay at the Orchard Hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Good location--right on cable car line, 2 blocks from Union Square, and 2 blocks from bus line to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: San Fran made easy
review.reviewText:
David at the front door was fantastic. Made finding our way around very easy.
All staff were very friendly and helpful

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first time to San Francisco and we were not familiar with the city at all. A friend of ours helped us book this hotel through Expedia. It was a very nice hotel and the location was great. Close to the cable car, easy for taxis and easy to walk to many places.

review.title: Couldn't ask for more
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was amazing, close to everything. It was great. Love the comfort of the room and I would recommend anyone to stay there.

review.title: Downtown San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for a stay in Downtown San Francisco

review.title: Not Baddd - but
review.reviewText: Had room off the street and it was quiet. No pool, no hot tub, no managers reception, just a pretty expensive room.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were comfortable and was close to the cablecar line.
review.locationRemarks: Easy cablecar ride to the warf

review.title: Comfortable and welcoming
review.reviewText: The hotel is very centrally located, just one block from Union Square and is accurately described as a boutique hotel, small and intimate. The rooms however are very spacious and comfortable and are fresh and well appointed. A nice touch is that they turn down the sheets at night and leave chocolates on the pillow. The staff are all very pleasant & helpful and always gave the impression that nothing was too much trouble. The only two downsides to the hotel, were that they don't currently offer meals (other than breakfast) and the bar closes at 9.30pm, which was disappointing. I believe they are in the process of addressing the meals issue and so hopefully this will in turn also resolve the bar one in due course. If your happy to eat out, then this hotel can be highly recommended, as it is very comfortable and welcoming.
review.positiveRemarks: The bedrooms were very comfortable and spacious
review.negativeRemarks: No restaurant for evening meals and a bar which closed at 9.30pm
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for the city centre, only one block from Union Square, a short walk to China Town and the Financial district and right next to a tram stop

review.title: Great place to stay in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel in the centre of the downtown area just up the hill form Union Square, an extra bonus is the cable car stop 10 yards from the door. The rooms are very comfortable and larger than you might expect and it is a pleasure to stay somewhere that is not part of the big chain uniformity. The staff are very friendly and could not have done more to help, a special mention to the two doormen who made each day so cheerful.
review.locationRemarks: A great Downtown location 10 yards form the cable car stop

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: a pleasant experience close to everything & pleasant staff
review.negativeRemarks: lighting
review.locationRemarks: great location for most things

review.title: Great hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: Great hotel for exploring Union Square and San Francisco. Very central, close to shopping and tourist attractions. Staff are very helpful and breakfast was very good. Very good sized room too.
review.positiveRemarks: Good sized room for a city centre hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very central, close to tour buses and attractions.

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff!
review.reviewText:
Friendly and helpful staff - staff was always very polite and would offer many helpful suggestions for restaurant ideas and travel plans.

Room was clean and pleasing.

Great locations - well within walking distance to China Town, Union Square Park, shopping, and public transport!

review.title: Swell!!!
review.reviewText: Fine location; spacious, clean, well-appointed room; very friendly staff; good value.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant was very attractive and fine for breakfast. But dinner is a work in progress? But with so many alternatives, it doesns't m Don't ask.

review.title: Quaint hotel 2 blocks north of Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed for 2 nights in the hotel which was close proximity to Union Square with out having to pay like you are that close. Easy access to tour buses and many local restaurants in the area.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, North Beach

review.title: Nice hotel - strange experience with TV
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Orchard. Nice hotel - friendly staff. In reading thru the materials they touted that they had a library of DVDs to check out at the main desk and we noticed that there was a DVD player in both the living room and the bedroom of our suite. So we checked out a movie and proceeded to try and figure out how you were supposed to switch the TV over from the cable signal to the DVD player. First I noticed on the back of the TV that DVD player wasn't even connected to the TV, so I connected it but still couldn't find an 'input' button on the TV or remote. We called the front desk, they had no clue and said a maintenance person would be right up to help us. We waited 45 minutes and noone ever came or called so I called the front desk again and was told "Oh, I guess when we upgraded the TVs, the DVD players become unusable because they are incompatible with the TVs." Huh? Basically what happened was they threw away all of the remotes that came WITH the TVs and use the Comcast remotes that don't allow you to switch inputs. The hotel also proudly displays a "Deep Sleep DVD" on the desk to give you some soft music and sound effects to help you sleep... but... again... you can't play it. Kind of frustrating, but most of all, REALLY dumb.
review.negativeRemarks: Media situation in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, Chinatown, Nob Hill, nice walk to North Beach and the wharf.

review.title: Well don
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful, the location was great, and the room was very nice. Great bed very comfortable.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
The location of this hotel was great! It was a few blocks from the shops, restaurants and entertainment of Union Square, as well as half a block from a cable car stop. And even though it was close to all of the action, it was just out of reach of the noise of the square, so the room was quiet at night.
The staff were very friendly and helpful and were able to provide recommendations on restaurants, things to see and places to shop. They were also very helpful with organizing transportation to the airport and tending to any other questions.

I would stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and friendly, helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No view from the hotel window.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops, restaurants, entertainment and transportation.

review.title: Service with a smile
review.reviewText: Excellent stay. Hotel staff couldn't have been more welcoming and helpful. A real gem.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Right at the centre of things

review.title: Better for couples
review.reviewText:
No room service. I booked this hotel for business for my boss and he was on east coast time so expected to have some sort of way to get food or drinks at all hours. Also, he said the fitness center was small with only a few treadmills.

A nice hotel, but better for couples. Not so much a business hotel.

Hotel was very accomodating however and staff was very helpful and ncie.

review.title: Nicely central to all city neighborhoods.
review.reviewText: This hotel had excellent staff - particularly the valet/concierge gentlemen. Extremely accommodating and helpful. The room was very nice, clean, comfortable and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Room should include a microwave and the DVDs should be available with player usable.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in a very safe part of the city, within easy walking to shopping, Union Square, Chinatown, and Saks! Also Pier 39 & Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Excellent hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean room, quiet environment and great location. What more needs to be said for a great stay near Union Square in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean room, quiet environment and great location. Fairly short walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown. Lots of good restaurants nearby

review.title: Great location and comfy bed
review.reviewText: Very convenient location in central part of city yet quiet and really comfortable bed/pillows - perfect for our short stay in San Franciso. We could walk to most everywhere and hotel organised good value black car for fairly easy exit back to airport. Perfectly suited our needs as a couple spending a few days in the city.

review.title: Ok Hotel
review.reviewText: The website of the Orchard does a good job of making it look much different than when you arrive. The restaurant was closed every night that I was there thus no room service. Thank goodness it is nearby to several restaurants. The rooms were ok but not up to date. The valet was the best part of the hotel. I wouldn't stay there again and I wouldn't recommend it to other people.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Good asian fusion called E&O trading company and close to Union Square

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The Orchard is a very nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco. You can catch the cable cars at the corner (maybe 30 feet) from the front entrance. The staff of the hotel were some of the most helpful people we met-giving us directions, what areas are ok to walk around in at night and they were very sweet about it and took their time with us. The rooms were very clean and well kept. One of the most comfortable beds we slept in on our trip...it was a great place!
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness of the staff, in close proximity to Fishermans Wharf, Lombard Street, Alcatraz, and the cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Everything was just a short cable car ride-They also have pamphlets in their lobby about all the tours that are offered of San Francisco.

review.title: very handy for Union Square area.
review.reviewText: Staff could not do enough for you and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the cable cars at 6am. But it is San Francisco!
review.locationRemarks: Central to Union Square area.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at Orchard Hotel for 3 nights. Our room was spacious, quiet, clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was huge and always stocked with plenty of towels. The staff and housekeepers were professional and courteous. It was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the free and fast wi-fi connection and plenty of channels to choose from on TV.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown, and Financial District were all within walking distance. Lots of shopping and dining establishments.

review.title: Nice hotel, well located
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, prompt service, clean environment
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, parking cost
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, trolleys, downtown shoping

review.title: Good location and adequate for a city vacation
review.reviewText: Not as good as I expected, a typical big city hotel, kind of small and average. Great location and walking distance to the tram and the bicycle / go kart tour rentals. Staff were nice and friendly.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: A little bit expensive but nicely located and a very pleasant hotel

review.title: Bed was SO comfortable
review.reviewText: The bed was SO comfortable. My room was spacious and well kept. It looks like the hotel has undergone some recent renovations and it looked good.
review.negativeRemarks: I asked for a room with a view, but my view wasn't spectacular
review.locationRemarks: great location near a cable car stop and several buses nearby.

review.title: OK, nice price
review.reviewText: The room was nice but ours in particular had an odd size and was right next to the elevator, which was pretty noisy. Also, the windows do not open.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a great area
review.reviewText: Great location and very comfortable, clean spacious rooms. The front desk staff and doormen/concierge were very helpful. No pool or gym, but there was so much to do in San Franciso. It us just a few short steps to the cable car and only about 6 blocks to the the Powell-Hyde St. cable car terminus. I would definitely stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: Clean, comfortable and spacious

review.title: Great service and hotel - recommended
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location, clean , comfortable and excellent service .
review.positiveRemarks: Nice clean hotel, good fittings and great friendly service from everyone
review.negativeRemarks: no complaints at all
review.locationRemarks: close to trolley and easy walk to union square,

review.title: Excellent, Comfortable and great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very comfortable and the location is convenient (union square within walking distance and cable car is just outside the hotel). I have ordered some online shopping and the hotel has assisted to received the delivery and safekeep for me. Many thanks!

review.title: Clean moderate hotel in great central location
review.reviewText: Very nice large room. Large bathroom. Very clean. Bed comfy but pillows had no support. I did not like pillows. Restaurant a bit pricey but really, for an extra $5.00 pp it is much nicer than the coffee shop on the corner. Keep in mind you may have to walk up a hill to get to hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Great central location. Very clean. Elegant. Not tacky or overdone. Simple check in and out.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows no support. Also, don't put the dirty decor pillows on the pillows where you lay your head.
review.locationRemarks: Near Market and Powell. Can walk to China Town. Close and easy to take public transportation to Fishermans Wharf or Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and excellent spacious room. No complaints. Would definitely stay there on my next visit to SF

review.title: great find
review.reviewText: Everything was great. Be prepared to walk up a section of steep slope. I love that it's in the city but not in the crowded regions. No homeless roaming along that stretch unlike those just ard Union Square.

review.title: Orchard Hotel - Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, would definately stay there again. Great location, great staff. Large bathroom and comfy bed. Only thing I would have changed is getting a room in the back of hotel instead of a room by the street. Even on the 6th floor, there was a fair amount of street noise.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
I would recommend this hotel based on its location.
It's location is fantastic an easy walk to the main shopping area right on a trolly stop.
A good range of restaurants near by within easy walking distance.
Staff basically friendly some more helpful than others, very hit and miss with the quality of customer service provided.
A big thank you to Cornell the doorman, he was great!!

Rooms not up to a standard for the price that we paid.
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Stylish San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
A really lovely quiet hotel close to the cable cars and convenient to all forms of transport. Staff were really friendly and efficient. Room was tastefully decorated with coffee making facilities. Could not fault this Hotel.
We booked this as a "mystery hotel" and it was extremely good value.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wifi, good area and convenient to transport
review.negativeRemarks: None all perfect
review.locationRemarks: Perfect and quiet. Historic cable cars run past the door and plenty of good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Would Reccomend
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay, very helpful doormen and desk staff. Well located and comfortable except our room was a little noisy with the tram close by but this ceased by midnight.
Would stay again but would request a room not facing Powell Street which the tram uses.

review.title: Recommended boutique hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location close to Union Square and the Powell St. cable car. But ask for a room on a higher floor and away from Powell...my first night was interrupted by repeated loud rumbling as the cable car goes by.That said, my request for a room change was promptly done and the 10th floor room on the other end of the hotel was quiet and restful. Rooms are large and well-appointed, if a bit generic. Bathrooms are roomy. Staff is courteous and pleasant. I prefer smaller hotels and this is one I would return to in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, comfortable rooms and good service
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from cable cars may bother light sleepers
review.locationRemarks: Ideal downtown location, but up a steep hill if you're walking there with luggage as I did!

review.title: Great Green Hotel in Great San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for four days at a large research conference. We prefer unique hotels instead of the big chains like the ones where the conference was held (Hilton, Hyatt. etc.). The Orchard fit the bill perfectly. It was just a 10-15 minute walk to various conference events and the shopping opportunities around Union Square (Don't miss Gumps!). It is also just a short walk to Chinatown where we had a great meal.
review.positiveRemarks: The green theme...eco friendly products, etc. Bellmen were very friendly and welcoming as was the cleaning staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The front desk people could be better. Seemed a bit distracted at times. When we first arrived, we were given keys to a room that someone else was in!
review.locationRemarks: It is close to everything we wanted to do in the Union Square area. And you can hop on the cable car just steps from the front door.

review.title: Great central hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent centrally located hotel - friendly staff and good service. Large comfortable room
review.positiveRemarks: Great location right by a cable car stop and just two blocks from union square. Perfect for shopping and eating out

review.title: Orchard hotel - great stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. I would sta here again

review.title: Large room at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: There is no real lobby. My room and bathroom were large by SF standards. There is AC in the room, though I didn't need it (mid-April). The bed was a little too soft but I slept alright. The room and the bathroom were very clean. There was a nice FM/CD player in the room. There is a minibar which keeps really cold but housekeeping apparently took my own beverages out of it. The desk and table were very comfortable. There is some noise from the street that didn't bother me but my colleague in another room was woken up by the garbage truck. The receptionists were very helpful and polite.
review.negativeRemarks: No real lobby area to meet people.
review.locationRemarks: It is not too far from Union square but on a rather steep street.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: Loved everything about this hotel...great servive, beautiful room, wonderful location!

review.title: Fun in SF
review.reviewText: Once to get a small fridge in room. Front Doorman very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Awesome friendly staff
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel. Great staff...really enjoyed my stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee is a little high, but it's San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to many shops, restaurants n china town.

review.title: Nice room, central location, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a friendly and helpful staff in a central location. My only real complaints were with the lack of a business center (I had a couple of documents that I needed to print) and some minor street noise. Overall, a pleasant experience.

review.title: Nice location, but noisy & slow WiFi.
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Orchard hotel for a week at the end of March. The hotel location is good (just two blocks from the Union square), close to all shopping and dinning sites and to all means of public transportation. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. My room was spacious, with two windows, equipped with a small refrigerator, mini locker, TV set and tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom was spacious too. I used the same day dry cleaning service ($12 for a jacket). You need to keep in mind that the hotel is located on a steep hill slope, but for me it was a pleasant walking exercise.
What I did not like was the outside noise (too thin window shields) and a very slow WiFi Internet connection most of the time, even in the nights. I used to stay at the Chancellor Hotel or at the Cornell Hotel de France in that area (this time they were completely sold out) and advise you to do so.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside noise, slow WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks uphill from the Union sq. The last block is on a very steep slope. Good shopping, dinning & all public transportation in 2-5 min walk.

review.title: Legit mid-range option.
review.reviewText: Good hotel and a good value. It's not going to be the greatest hotel you ever stayed, but you could do a LOT WORSE for a comparable price in this city.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly service and a good value
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for walking to Union Square shopping and to Chinatown

review.title: Perfect location and great service!
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was such a great place to stay! It was in the perfect location and had fantastic service! It was very clean!! We loved staying here and would definitely recommend it to others!
review.locationRemarks: It was close to everything. You could hop on the cable car right out the door or walk to several restaurants and shops! It was quiet at night!

review.title: Very nice recommend
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - lobby was small and not fancy but the room was perfect and nicer/bigger then I thought. Don't let the unassuming outside and entryway fool you . Staff was helpful and informative
review.positiveRemarks: Had a small issue with a bill from Expedia not the hotel and the manager took extra time just to make sure I was happy - wow talk about extra service

review.title: Heaven on a Hill
review.reviewText: Great Location, but be prepared to walk those famous hills of San Francisco. Within walking distance to Chinatown, and Union Square- the cable car stop is right outside the door at the corner. Hotel staff very very nice. Little mini mart a short walk down the hill, and several good places to eat nearby. I would recommend the Orchard Hotel if they want to be near Union Square and Chinatown for great shopping and dining, you won't be disappointed. The bed was simply heaven after a long day of walking, and the hotel very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff greeted you by name, everytime you walked through the lobby door
review.negativeRemarks: Too quiet- no white noise.
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car Stop right outside the door on the corner, The Jade Gate of Chinatown just down the Hill, and Union Square a short walk also.

review.title: fraudsters hurting for money
review.reviewText: The hotel is clearly hurting for money. There were no other guests staying here. The hotel fraudulently debited my card for a $500 smoking fee in which was illegitimate. Nobody from the hotel called. Nobidy from our room smoked as it was made clear that there was a fee. I'll never stay here again.

review.title: Comfortable hotel, great location.
review.reviewText:
Great service started at check in, after a long journey we were given just enough information to get us going including a map of San Francisco. When we were ready for some advice on restaurants and booking a wine tour staff were extremely helpful.

The room was large, clean and had an super comfortable bed. The bathroom was also a good size with plenty of hot water.

We didn't eat at the hotel, there are plenty of restaurants and food outlets around Union Square where the hotel is located.

review.title: Great location, friendly, clean hotel
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great - just a couple of (hilly) blocks from Union Square. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Room was large, clean and bright. Bathroom was huge and spotless. Great value for money. Will definitely stay here again on any future visit.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, be prepared for the hills throughout San Fran!

review.title: Great hotel, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Conveniently located for easy access to cable cars and Union Square. Close to lots of retaurants and shopping. Excellent, helpful staff. Quiet room
review.negativeRemarks: No pool or hot tub
review.locationRemarks: Great spot, close to everything

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: I visited this hotel with my partner for 1 week and would normally stay at the marriot however I am so glad I tried something different as I was not disappointed and would recommend this hotel for everything, location, staff, cleanliness etc including the free wi-fi which was fantastic. I would without doubt stay at this hotel again should I be visiting San Fran.
review.locationRemarks: Around the corner from union Sq and the cable car stops nearly outside.

review.title: San Francisco Beauty!
review.reviewText: Phenomenal boutique hotel, absolutely lovely! Wonderful find in Nob Hill!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, beautiful rooms and large bathroom, perfect location.
review.negativeRemarks: Really none
review.locationRemarks: Love Nob Hill due to walking for great exercise

review.title: No need to look further....
review.reviewText:
We were charmed by our stay at the Orchard Hotel and will definitely return as soon as we can and often. The room is large/the beds are plush/the pillows too/the staff was so much more than accommodating....they were knowledgeable, interested in how our days were going/ and went beyond the call of duty for several of our requests. When we returned from our first dinner out to find the bed turned down and chocolates awaiting us we felt fully welcomed.
We love the location of this gem of a hotel....it is only blocks from Union Square, from China Town and from great shopping....we walked absolutely everywhere....this hotel is central to everything and right on the trolley line.
review.positiveRemarks: the welcoming and knowledgeable staff and the central location
review.negativeRemarks: no real view from the room
review.locationRemarks: close to absolutely everything and transportation was right at our doorstep if we wanted to go further

review.title: Deserve to stay in for pleasure or business
review.reviewText: At first glance hotel appears a bit old. But after the first day of stay you change your mind. Big room and bathroom, clean, desk and all minor but neccessary things like iron, safe, desk make your stay comfortable. On top you have excellent location.
review.positiveRemarks: staff attention to my needs and cleanless
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We visit SF regularly and this is the first time we have stayed at the Orchard. We were so impressed by the hotel that we will stay at the Orchard on future visits. Given the price this is a fantastic hotel in a great location. All the staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was large, comfortable, tastefully furnished and clean. The bed was comfortable. The room looked like the photos on Expedia. We will certainly recommend the Orchard to family and friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square, cable car and Market St transport

review.title: I'm glad I find a right hotel for me
review.reviewText: The room is very clean and comfortable. It's very quiet at night

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText:
Friendly people,comfy beds and pillows, very clean, great location.

Enjoyed the stay
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: One block form union square- right next to powell cable car stop.

review.title: What a gem!
review.reviewText: What a refreshing change from other hotels! Small, classy, well-appointed, quiet and comfortable. Spent three nights and was greeted each and every day by friendly, professional staff who remembered my name. Breakfast room service took 10 minutes for a hot meal. Location perfect to Union Square. What a gem!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to disappoint me.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for Union Square.

review.title: Wonderful Stay-Highly Recommend this Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel and location close to Union Square downtown San Francisco. Walking distance within a few blocks to excellent restaurants. This hotel had a great bed and was lovely-I would highly recommend it, particularly to business travelers due to its location.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, two blocks from Union Square. Pleasant staff, clean rooms and comfortable beds.

review.title: Great boutique hotel!
review.reviewText: Beautiful boutique hotel in a great location off Powell. Cable car stop right outside the hotel. Only issue we had was our shuttle service to the airport. We paid a deposit and apparently was suppose to get a slip and the person at the front desk didnt give us one. We ended up having to pay the shuttle company more when we arrived at the airport. The hotel settled it for us about 1hour later.

review.title: Great location and good value.
review.reviewText: Nice room with good sized bathroom...great location...restaurant on premises with good breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Great location...easy walking distance to Union Square and Nordstrom... cable stop at corner to waterfront...

review.title: Disappointing after previous stays
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel five times before. We've always been treated well, but this stay has turned me off completely. I feel so awful that I was the one who suggested this hotel over other more economical and better located hotels.

The room smelled moldy and felt damp. The bathtub didn't work and took a full day to repair. There seemed to be no interest from the front desk to relocate to another room, even though the hotel was less than full.

Yes, this was a less expensive room, but I've certainly booked more expensive rooms with them. Often I book direct, perhaps they don't like guests who book through Expedia.

Basically, for my twice yearly trips to SF, I'll be staying at the Abri instead.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell, lack of responsiveness
review.locationRemarks: On top of a hill, so be prepared to hike.

review.title: Great hotel to explore the Union Sq. District
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent. Room was very clean and comfortable. Good location close to Union Square and cable cars.

review.title: Hidden gem.
review.reviewText: I would definitly stay here again. Its perfect for location,quiet,safe and private. Price good
review.locationRemarks: Perfect walking distance to everywhere

review.title: Comfortable hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We stayed five nights and found the hotel and staff excellent in every respect.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, very comfortable room, and fast elevators
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: about five easy blocks from Powell St. BART station and two blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel for couples or business
review.reviewText: I am a "germ-a-phobe." I do not like hotels. I was apprehensive when my partner booked the Orchard. After arriving and staying 5 days, we were very impressed with the cleanliness and service of the hotel and staff. I would definitely stay there again!
review.negativeRemarks: the front desk forgot to call van for pickup to airport. But they made up for it with a Limo : )!
review.locationRemarks: location was downtown but far enough for the "humdrum"

review.title: Great getaway
review.reviewText: We thought it was one of the nicer places we have stayed at in San Francisco. Great location, but still nice and quite. The staff was very helpful, and we used them often.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The Orchard is a very nice hotel in a great location. It is a bit small and boutique like for my tastes. I prefer a larger hotel.

Parking is expensive and it's cumbersome getting your car when you want it.

I also like to have some kind of view in San Francisco, and all I had was the back of buildings.

But, if you don't have a car, and you don't care about a view, it's a very nice hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Part of Town
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is one of 2 sister hotels located within a couple of blocks of each other. We stayed for one night before catching a plane in the morning. The front desk attendants were very friendly and helpful, warning me about the towing issues on the street if your car is still there after 7am. The aesthetics of the hotel were warm and traditionally sophisticated, with elevators easily accessible in the lobby. Our corner room on the fifth floor was very spacious and well-cleaned. The bathroom was oversize and very clean as well. I would certainly recommend this to couples or anyone on business looking to stay near the financial district.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful and friendly front desk. Spacious rooms and bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: No city view. $40 per day valet.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location just a couple of blocks from Union Square and the Financial district. Great restaurants everywhere.

review.title: Great hotel for the money!
review.reviewText: All in all a great stay. Very friendly staff. Only issue was that there was no ice machine on our floor.

review.title: Great hotel for seeing the best of San Francisco
review.reviewText: My hotel stay at Orchard was excellent. I was greeted by a very friendly bellhop and front desk attendant. The rooms were clean and comfortable. While small, it was enough room for a friend and I who were eager to see the city. The cable car (which we could not hear from room 311) became a crucial means of transportation going north and south as well as easy and west. Conveniently there was a stop right outside the hotel. We were a short walk away from Union Square, Chinatown, the Ferry Building, and other attractions. The front desk attendant on one day, Suna, helped me plan out a morning where I only had 4 hours to sightsee. I told her I wanted to see Twin Peaks, Golden Gate Park, and Haight Ashbury. I asked her if it was possible using mass transit and she said yes. She armed me with printed directions to get me from place to place via bus and I was able to execute and see all three! I am grateful to have found this hotel and look forward to staying here again when I come back to San Francisco! Thanks, Orchard Hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, and the extremely helpful and warm staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelled like fried chicken in my room one evening and I'm not sure where the smell came from! Smells were wafting in from an unknown location!
review.locationRemarks: It was perfectly situated to see everything!

review.title: WARNING
review.reviewText: WARNING - room 207 - On arrival the hotel was good, room was very nice and staff very helpful, but that's where it stops, if you book into this hotel make sure you check the room for noise. I had hoped to have a good nights sleep prior to a long flight the next day...the clanking and screeching from the cable cars was dreadful, when I went down at 11.30pm to enquire as to when the trams/cable cars stopped running I was asked "Where did I want to go?" "To Sleep" was my answer, I was told they stopped between 12.15am through to 1am but no offer to change rooms, just told you learn to sleep with it!! once they actually stop at 1am, make the most of it because the cable cars start up again at 4.30am. My son and partner stayed in room 502 opposite side of hotel and didn't have this problem as they were much higher.
review.negativeRemarks: Loud noise from cable cars
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Quiet Respite from City Noise
review.reviewText: Very attentive staff - comfortable and quiet room.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was wonderful - ready and willing to meet my every need.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location.

review.title: Hotel can't be beat!
review.reviewText: This hotel is terrific. The location is two blocks from Union Square and 50 feet from the cable car line. Our room, 1010, was wonderful. The beds were very comfy and the bathroom was huge. This hotel is aging gracefully, so expect a few slightly worn places in your room; maybe your tv is not a flat screen or the bathroom wallpaper has a loose corner. But everything was very clean and well tended to. The staff was so helpful with any request, including booking tours, hailing cabs or any other need. We felt safe, comfortable and well cared for.
review.negativeRemarks: Large hill on Powell Street.
review.locationRemarks: Couldn't be better. In the heart of downtown San Francisco

review.title: Quiet, Clean, Spacious, Comfy Beds
review.reviewText: First night we arrived with rental car there was nowhere to park in front of hotel. We parked down the street in a garage. Didn't realize the garage was on different levels with different street exits because of steep streets...we couldn't find our way out of level 5 to Bush Street. Local walkers helped us after even they struggled to find a way out..you must go down one floor, take elevator down to 2nd fl. and leave via a very hard to find exit to Bush St. Garage cost was about $30/day opposed to hotel valet service at $45/day. Hotel seems to be in a seedy part of town, but we felt safe walking at night even though there are vagrants/scammers everywhere. Our room and bathroom were spacious & clean...beds were comfortable...luxury sheets, turndown service at night. entertainment center with lg. screen TV, lg. desk w/chair. Very quiet in hallway, no loud noises from rooms to interrupt our sleep. We stayed for two weeks, so we brought a lot of stuff. Appreciated cleaning staff who worked around our belongings. We used the safe for our money and jewelry. It was very easy to lock and open. Shower water is hot right away. Liked the full length mirror by the door. A sofa would have been nice, but a suite was very expensive. Our twin bed room was very expensive as it was. Our door key didn't work twice, so we had to go downstairs to have the desk clerk work with it. Didn't try the hotel restaurant bec. it looked dead. Overall, a good experience, but parking sucks.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, Walking Distance to Chinatown, Port of San Francisco, Department Stores
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Liked it.
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Convinient to everything. Friendly and helpful staff. Had a nice time.

review.title: Great Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is in a great location to be able to walk to shops and access main public transport. We found the service and rooms of a high standard and would definitely recommend other travellers to stay there. Of all of the hotels we stayed at in the USA this hotel was the best. Excellent beds, rooms very comfortable, free wifi in rooms, staff are very friendly, engaging and helpful. We would stay here again without hesitation.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff very friendly
Close to a lot of SF attractions

review.title: My secret tip for a hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: A charming, sunny, happy litte hotel that has everything you need for a pleasant stay. Extremely well located (close to Union Square, Nob Hill, Chinatown), central and still very quiet. A very friendly and efficient staff at reception, and concierge.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant at night was empty. Not a problem there are very good restaurants nearby. Breakfast was pleasant enough.
review.locationRemarks: Optimal

review.title: Recommended...
review.reviewText: Nice sized, clean room. and quiet room. Just off the beaten path but close to everything. Included internet, friendly, helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill, just up from Union Square. Good restaurants near by.

review.title: Perfect for a relaxing stay in the city
review.reviewText: My stay was delightful! I will attempt to stay here whenever I am in San Francisco - if there is availability! I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff. I truly enjoyed the location as well as I was mere blocks from Chinatown and Union Square. So much nicer than a large, crowded chain hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff makes you feel welcome whenever you enter the hotel and always greets you when you depart. They truly make the stay special.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to reach everything in the city but once in your room, you couldn't hear any outside noise. Wonderful!

review.title: Great service and comfort
review.reviewText: Great Location, clean, quiet, and the staff was excellent!

review.title: Will come back to Orchard Hotel
review.reviewText: All in all, a very enjoyable stay and experience at the Orchard Hotel. Service has been exceptional and the hotel is very conveniently located. My only criticism is that the general light switch in the room produces an orange LED light when turned off and hence, there is no complete darkness when you going to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: The general light switch in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location except the final 150m steep climb from Sutter to Bush

review.title: Great hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Staff was wonderful! Quiet, clean rooms. Great location!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was excellent. Close to everything a tourist would want and need without the busy crowds.
review.negativeRemarks: Not too many. Perhaps a more updated TV, restaurant service would be nice all day.

review.title: Great hotel in a wonderful location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice for a downtown San Francisco hotel. It was very convienent to the cable car line, shopping in Union Square and China Town. The room was very large and the bathroom was very nice. The TV was a little old but I'm not that picky. I was a little disappointed with one of the front desk crew who was a little short with us when asking about nearby restaurants but the bellman, David, was very nice! I also liked that they were eco-friendly. Some hotels put out the cards but don't really do what it says so I appreciated it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, space, comfortable bed and nice bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Running out of the newspaper in the am, uphill climb at the end of the day
review.locationRemarks: Straight north of Union Square (3 blocks, 1 major uphill), Powell cable car line is right outside the door. 2 blocks west of China Town south entrance

review.title: Great hotel and excellent service.
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel and the location was close to Chinatown so that made it even better. The service by everybody was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown

review.title: Nice, but a bit tough to get to.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located about two blocks north of Union Square. It is close to Chinatown. The only real drawback about its location is that the last block to the hotel is a fairly steep climb. I reserved a king bed for a two night stay for my daughter and I. What was disappointing is that we were charged $25 per night for the cot. One consolation is that it was a very comfortable cot. Therefore, its a nice hotel except for the steep walk and what I would say is an unreasonable charge for a cot.

review.title: Good base for business or leisure in SF
review.reviewText: Convenient location, comfortable rooms, and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The "gym"
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and walking distance to financial district.

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: Helpful staff - very clean and convenient and individual attention for all guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Dining
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Once great!
review.reviewText: I've stayed here 5 or 6 times, sorry to say things are on a downswing. 5 day stay, no bath soap (only tiny face soap...1), outdated shampoo.... no buffet breakfast, stained carpet and weak internet. Sorry Orchard... this was our last stay! As we were told, its the recession, cutbacks.... yep, cutbacks on everything but the prices!
review.locationRemarks: Great location, 2 blocks from Union Square and Nob Hill... on a Cable car line.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: great hotel, with a great location, cable car right on the corner.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of city, easy to get the cable car and close to China town
review.locationRemarks: Great because you are right in the middle of everything

review.title: Would stay here again and would recommend it.
review.reviewText:
Amazingly quiet room. We never heard anyone on the sides of us or above us. We had room 804. Very comfortable bed and nice linens. Bathroom was decent but nothing overly special except the size was great because two of us could be in there getting ready at the same time and not bumping into one another.

We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but it seemed pretty decently priced for what it was. (There are so many other eating options in the area that they have to keep prices reasonable or people just won't even bother.#

Issues were minor/fairly insignificant. The bathroom mirror had decorative corners but two of the four were broken off. Hot water one morning was more warm than hot #still warm enough to take a shower but I wonder if their hot water system borders on marginal capacity?). Also if you prepay, make sure you pay attention on checkout becuase thye at first didn't have me as prepaid and would have charged me a 2nd time so just ensure that it's clear that you prepaid. It was no issue straightening it ou.

Totally would stay here again and recommend it to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C worked OK but it was cooler weather outside too. It was never aggressive so I wonder how well it'd do in a rare SF heatwave.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty centrally located near Union Square and the trolley goes right by 1/2 block away.

review.title: Cute boutique hotel with great location
review.reviewText: This was our second stay in San Francisco and second time at this hotel. We will make it the hotel we stay at every time we visit San Francisco. The bed is very comfortable, the room and bathroom is spacious. There is a variety of TV channels, which was a plus (we stayed here during the U.S. Open so were able to tune in to the Golf Channel before it hit NBC). The location cannot be beat: approximately 2 blocks away from shopping and union square, 3 blocks away from Chinatown, and right on a Powell street car line. There are cute cafes and bars a couple of blocks away, and a great pizza place (Uncle Vito's?) caddy corner. The staff was nice. No complaints about the service. We even enjoyed the dvds they offer. My husband said the fitness room was small with pretty much just a treadmill, but that is all he needs so it worked out. If you are in town for business and need a business center, they don't really have one, but you may use the Orchard Garden's business center 2 blocks down. We did not check it out, but something to note for business travelers.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, charm, friendly staff, comfy beds
review.negativeRemarks: No view from our room
review.locationRemarks: Great! Very near Nob Hill, Chinatown, and Union Square. Easy to get a taxi from location.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay in San Francisco after our visit to Napa. Very close to some of our favorite restaurants.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Great location close to a cable car line and other public transit. Friendly staff. Quiet rooms. I would be happy to stay again.

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel! We were late arriving because of flight delay and they were ready and waiting for us when we walked in the door. Especially enjoyed friendliness and helpfullness of doormen David and Cornell! The bed and pillows were so soft and comfortable, everything neat and clean. The Orchard Hotel helped make our vacation great! Will definately return.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, bed and pillows, friendly staff, location
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Great location right near Union Square for shopping and next to cable car stop for travel to other parts of the city.

review.title: nice,pleasant, well located
review.reviewText: nice,pleasant, well located, good rooms, the gym is non existant which was disappointng

review.title: Ortchard Excellent
review.reviewText:
room was awesome

staff were extremely helpful and courteous

review.title: Stop-over in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
An older-style building but with the advantage of having nice, big, spacious rooms. We were very comfortable and Wifi internet was free and available in our room. Near Union Square it was in a handy, central position. Shopping, restaurants, tours are all within walking distance.
Management was efficient and courteous.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing stands out.
review.locationRemarks: Nice and centrally, located.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and in excellent condition. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location was great. We did not eat in the dining room so cannot comment as to that part of the hotel, but it looked very nice. The Orchard made for a great San Franciso get-away. We would stay there again or recommend it to friends.

review.title: Philadelphia traveller
review.reviewText: Superb location; courteous staff; large nice room; courtesy wireless. Excellent value for money.

review.title: Friendliest Hotel in SFO
review.reviewText:
Front staff made you feel as though you were awere a returning guest. Extremely helpful and friendly. (Especially Grace)
The room was very comfortable even though they have not yet transitioned to newer TV equipment.
review.negativeRemarks: TV equipment
review.locationRemarks: Good location near Chinatown and Union Square

review.title: Great Hotel especially for the Price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great room, good location and excellent price. Will definitely use again

review.title: Good boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Good boutique hotel a couple of blocks from Union Square

review.title: Orchard review.
review.reviewText: Great little boutique hotel. Clean and comfortable , good location, good bed.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, good bathroom, small but comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much of a sitting area in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to everything.

review.title: Rom 809
review.reviewText: The concierge, David, was exceptional and went out of his way to help us with anything we needed ranging from places to eat, tours, places to go in the city, anything we needed in the room etc. The staff were great, the hotel very central and right on the cable car stop, very comfortable and very spacious rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Service, cleanliness, comfortable, spacious and centrally located
review.negativeRemarks: Wallpaper dated
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and right on a cable car stop to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Outstanding in every way!
review.reviewText: The perfect place to stay! The staff was amazing. The concierge, David, was spot on with recommendations for dining and seeing the city. We will definitely stay again!

review.title: Real SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location whether you're on business or pleasure. Use their airport car service if you want it's a little more than a taxi but far superior. The room was large and comfortable with wifi and, evnthough their tv system was a little dated, everything worked just fine. I would go back.

review.title: Our second stay, great service and location. Rooms are nice
review.reviewText: Service was excellent both times, location is next to corner of Powell and Bush. (Trolly stops at this corner) Walk to Sears Restaurant, Union Square, China Town. Only problem is a/c goes off during night. Don't know if it is service issue or just being "green". Would stay there again.

review.title: wonderful
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with our experience. We had a little difficulty with getting our room made up one day and, with that exception, this is a wonderful hotel in a great location.

review.title: Orchard Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice property - clean and updated - but without in-room entertainment and without room-service the clean and comfortable rooms are less-than relative to other properties.

review.title: Good location; close to all typesof transportation.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard hotel for 3 nights. It was clean and in a good location. It was close to all forms of transportation including BART, and the cable car stops almost right out front of the hotel. The people at the front desk were very helpful.

review.title: 3 days in 'Frisco
