review.reviewText: Hotel was in an excellent location and convenient for all we wanted.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was close to everything including major bus/trolley car routes. The room was really comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would most definitely stay there again.

review.title: Happy USA visitor
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable and convenient hotel. Glad we chose Union Square area above Fisherman's wharf area - more to see and do there.
Very friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Right on a cable car line, it is a close walk to Chinatown and Union Square. About twenty minutes from North Beach. There is a fantastic French restaurant a few blocks east - Cafe de La Presse.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel at an excellent location: 3 minutes to the Union Square, right on the Powell Street with the legendary cable car. Across the street to my favorite Sushi Toni and few blocks from our offices on 530 Bush St.

review.title: Great Hotel, Excellent location!!
review.reviewText:
I did a lot of research before I decided to choose the Orchard Hotel. The research paid off! This was a great location just steps from the gates to China town. The cable cars were just on the corner of Bush and Powell. Perfect!!
We walked through China town, Little Italy (north beach), all the way to the pier the first day, which I think wasn't a bad walk at all...
the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. This is a great choice for a hotel, if you find the right price, go ahead and book it!

Have irish coffes at Buena Vista if you get a chance...very charming!!

Must see's are Alamo Square, and Twin Peaks!! Haight-Ashbury was a gas!! Whoo hoo!!

Dinner one night at The Franciscan.....excellent!! Beautiful view......

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
This is my favorite hotel in San Francisco. My room was immaculate and comfortable, and even though it faced the street (Bush), it was very quiet.

I was most impressed that housekeeping was also unusually quiet, which is a great luxury, especially since the Orchard Hotel is used by a lot of business people, who tend to be out and about early.

The people at the front desk are helpful and kind.

It's very convenient from two BART/Muni stations, Powell and Montgomery, and 1.5 blocks from the Chinatown Gate.

review.title: Real nice hotel but that hill!!
review.reviewText:
Nob Hill... That's the one you gotta walk up to get there.

But this hotel is a little gem in terms of value. The room is pretty much what you'd see in any of the 4 star Hiltons, Hyatts, Marriotts nearby. The TV isn't a flatscreen but the bathroom is better than most.

review.title: Surprisingly pleasant
review.reviewText: Well, I stayed in couple of hotel in SF (Westin, Parc55, Hilton Financial District, LeMeridien) and I have to say that I was not expecting much from Orchard (I booked it because all the other options were either sold out or terribly expensive). At the end, it was quite good. The room was big and surprisingly nice (Westin & Le Meridien are of course nicer, but one would expect that), hotel location perfect. Only drawback is the view - there's none.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be very good, good location, friendly staff, 2 blocks from union square and on the Cable car line which was good for getting around.

review.title: Nice Hotel, but watch out for Expedia snobbiness
review.reviewText: This is undoubtedly a nice hotel, but we were given a room with 2 double beds instead of the King room we requested with Expedia. The woman at the counter was very snotty about our having used Expedia and their inability to guarantee our room "request." Otherwise, it was a nice experience.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Large comfortable King room, nice restaurant, two blocks from Union Square and Chinatown at a great price.

review.title: Love the Orchard. Staff and room was splendid!
review.reviewText: What was a trying travel was smoothed out by the Orchard Hotel and staff. Each call was inviting. Arrival was rewarding! Beautiful hotel.

review.title: I love the Orchard Hotel!!
review.reviewText:
From the location, which can' t be beat, to the service, which is matchless, to the comfort of the room, this is an outstanding hotel. It sits on Bush Street just off of Powell, so the cable car is just steps away, and it's an easy downhill walk to Union Square or to China Town. I used to live a few blocks up Bush Street so it's familiar territory for me and truly like coming home. This was my second stay; as long as I can find a package within my budget that includes this property this is my hotel of choice.
The only less than immaculate thing was a little bit of mildew in some shower tiles, but other than that, the rooms are spotless. As for the staff, I had a problem with my TV (pre-programmed for closed captioning which I insisted I could not live with! No way, no how!) and they promptly switched the TV for another one for which I was immensely grateful. Everyone here is helpful, cheerful, smiling. This is an absolutely dreamy hotel.

Just a word to first time visitors to the City by the Bay: this is a cramped, NOISY city. If you are downtown (especially in a vintage building), expect to hear street noise, it's just a fact of life here. Bring earplugs, you'll be happier!

review.title: Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is located very near Union square and China Town. The beds were comfortable.

review.title: New Orleans Chinese Language Conference
review.reviewText:
I like the quaint feeling o fhte hotel. Initial check in posed a proble as a booked a room with a kings bed but was given a room with 2 twin beds...thought those went out with Lucy & ricki...lol.
the next night i was moved to an appropriately suited room...king bed.

Overall the staff were accommodating during my stay.

review.title: Great location at an affordable price
review.reviewText:
My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the Orchard Hotel in San Fran April 2011. Everything about this hotel was great. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was very clean, spaceous, with a big bathroom, that was also very clean. They had a fully stocked mini bar and cozy robes. All the things you would see in a more expensive hotel. For the price this place was amazing
My only complaint was that our 8th floor view was a bunch a buildings, not a bit of sky in sight. I know if I would have asked we could have been moved to a room with a better view.
The hotel was right on the trolly line and with in blocks of additional public transportaion, fine resturants, shopping and more.
I can't wait to go back to San Fran and will stay again at the Orchard Hotel.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText:
My husband and I stayed here in the begining of
april. the hotel was excellent! the service was also excellent! The restaurant in the hotel was horriible! the need to revamp it completely! We ordered coffee and left because thats how bad it was. The coffee was horrible and so was the server.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The Orchard was an extremely nice and comfortable hotel. The service was great, the room was a bit small, but very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and the entire hotel looked like it was recently updated. The bar and restaurant staff were very courteous. I would definitely go back when I visit San Francisco again.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Only problem we had was on our last night the A/C went out for the entire hotel. Was not extremely uncomfortable, but was rather warm. Could not open any windows

review.title: Lovely stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Being our first time in San Francisco, we were not sure what to expect and after a very long flight, it was nice to be welcomed at a friendly hotel and a nice comortable room & clean room. We had requested a room overlooking the street and we got what we requested, which was nice. The staff were welcoming and plesant. pointed us in the right direction and provided maps if required. We did book a City & Alcatraz tour with the hotel, but we were a little disappointed how it was handled. Tour bookings are booked at reception, and over the phone with the booking agent via the hotel. The bookings guy, procceded to read our credit card details our loud while people where at the reception area. Not very professional. Even though the city tour & alcatraz tour was PERFECT. Highly reccommend it. Overall the stay was enjoyable & looking forward to returning in the future (great shopping to be had).

review.title: okay hotel, nothing special
review.reviewText:
the hotel is old school and very basic hotel, definitely dated and personally it didn't give me the feel of any charm. it's just a straightforward check- in check -out nothing- special- here- to- see -kinda -place. it was however, clean, convenient, the location is central on a significantly historic and nice stretch of Bush street, which brings you close to a real San Francisco experience. walking distance to union square and china town. a few nice cafes and bars around.
the hotel staff were sufficiently nice and accomodating, but room service is quite limited, so plan accordingly

review.title: affordable luxury in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was absolutely lovely. The room was comfortable, stylish and luxurious. It was quiet and clean and the service was superb. The concierges and doormen were extremely helpful in giving advice or directions. It is also in an ideal neighborhood, close to Bart, shops, restaurants, Chinatown. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Best SF boutique hotel experience
review.reviewText: Very clean, easy streamlined process, great service, courteous, unintrusive, next to a self-service parking garage if you are driving, excellent location within walking distance to downtown destinations, restaurants, and public transport, best SF boutique hotel experience for me so far.

review.title: Would pick Orchard again for next trip to SF
review.reviewText:
Great location downtown, very convenient. Hotel was clean, quite, and staff very friendly. Excellent value. Free wifi was a bit slow (I assume the whole neighborhood is using it since it is unsecure.)

As others have noted, the last block is a bit steep if you're coming, from say, the Powell Street BART station but if you're someone who is reasonably fit and enjoys exploring cities by walking, it will be no problem.

review.title: Very good, affordable, just off Union Sq.
review.reviewText: Very happy with the hotel

review.title: Not spectacular, but nice enough
review.reviewText: The Orchard hotel is supposed to be a luxury boutique hotel and I was expecting something unique and luxurious. The lobbay, elevators and rooms are not 'luxurious' in my opinion. But the location is convenient and I would stay here again if I couldn't find a better deal in the Union Square neighbourhood.

review.title: will be back in april
review.reviewText: it was my first time to this hotel .it was a great experience.the front office staff were very nice amazing views

review.title: Overnighter, Will Return
review.reviewText: This was a charming little hotel, and everything was comfy and plush, robes in the closet which I did not see until the next day on check out!!...It had European feel to the room...I personally would have enjoyed a nicer bathtub, like a soaking tub...and a flat screen tv would have been perfect for the room. Maybe that's why I felt like I was in Italy....To be honest I would love to stay a couple of nights and really enjoy the restaurant and the hotel more.

review.title: cozy and convenient
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Orchard Hotel during the holiday shopping season. It is well located near Union Square but you do have to walk up a steep hill to get to the hotel from Union Square. Otherwise it is quite convenient to shopping and restaurants.

The rooms are a little on the small size but well appointed and comfortable. The staff was friendly and efficient and always offered to help. I would definitely consider staying there again.

review.title: A Green Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
We have usually stayed closer to Union Square, but this time found this "Green Hotel" just 2 blocks out. Its a great Hotel, very clean, very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms very open and light, unless you wanted it dark. The beds were very comfortable, the courtesy robes were very nice.

It is "uphill" from Union Square, but not overly steep. However, if you have mobility issues it may present a challenge. The Cable Car stop is a few feet away at the corner and the doorman can call a cab if needed. Great resturants, theater, and stores a short walk away. We plan on staying there again.

review.title: Orchard Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good experience; convenient location for conference hotels, shopping, and restaurants in downtown San Francisco. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Added to one of my favorite in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location and clean room made our stay quite enjoyable.

review.title: A great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: A really great hotel in a great location, The staff were very helpful. You can walk around most of the main city sights from the hotel. The tram stops at the corner so take a ride down to fisherman's wharf. Walk right from the hotel (towards China town) and you will find a small grocery store (you can buy water, fruit, sandwiches, milk etc). Lovely big room with a comfortable bed, large TV, individual coffee machine and a fridge to store the water. Nice large bathroom. Really nice. Catch a cable car, catch a tram and a bus (all easy to catch) and a cheap way around when the steep streets get a little much. Don't forget to visit Lombard Street, you will be amazed at this steep street. Would love to go back

review.title: Perfect location to explore wonderful San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a perfect location to Union Square and downtown. The room was large and well appointed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
clean & comfortable, good location, very nice staff.

I would stay here again.

review.title: Old world charm
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is in a great location for sightseeing San Francisco. The staff are friendly and very helpful and on the day we arrived the concierge on duty, Cornell, immediately brought us brochures of things to see and do while in his city. A short walk down the hill brought you to many restaurants and a very large Westfield shopping mall. Catching a trolly (or are they called cable cars??) is easy as it's only on the corner from the hotel and it's a quick trip down to Fisherman's Wharf. A stroll 2 blocks down the road from the hotel is Chinatown. Some of the areas didn't look to nice for 2 ladies on their own but I was told it would be OK providing we were back before it got too late. If I had to get picky I could come up with three complaints. One would be the darkness of the room (very difficult to read because of the low lighting) 2. the coffee maker which only made one cup at a time. The cups are very large (and they only give you one tea bag, one regular coffee packet and one decafe coffee packet which for 2 people is definately NOT enough). so the one packet didn't give you more than a light coloring and no coffee flavor. (I did ask the maid for more but never got it.) 3. They have a computer in the lobby to check e-mails and print boarding passes. It's on a very high tabletop which at my 5'3" made typing almost impossible as the keyboard was almost chin level! I think this was the most frustrating problem to overcome in this otherwise very nice hotel.

review.title: if the price is right
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, but best of all it's a great central location.

review.title: Great spot, nice room.
review.reviewText: Hotel is located right next to cable car stop, central to everything. Staff was nice and very accommodating. Restaurant was very good too. I'd definitely stay there again.

review.title: Orchard was great
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful! bathroom was bigger than I expected and there was a vanity mirror! we walked to chinatown and shopping area. loved it! thought I requested a room with one bed but they gave us a room with two beds. the beds were quite small so we slept separately but they were so comfortable so I didn't complain. overall great stay

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Unfortunately, I was somewhat disappointed with the Orchard Hotel. My husband and I stayed there for 1 night during a weekend in San Francisco. The rate we got via Expedia was fairly high. Pros: proximity to Union Square, Powell BART station, and many eateries. The bed was very comfortable. Cons: The carpet was slightly "damp" over the entire room when we checked in. We weren't certain if it was from a carpet cleaning or a leak somewhere - but being that we checked in at 10:30 pm (late flight), we were too exhausted to switch rooms. It smelled like mildew the next morning. In the morning, my husband tried to take a shower and we had to call maintenance since there was no hot water. They did manage to fix it fairly quickly. Oh, and there was no cream for the in-room coffee.. but by that time I just wanted to get out of there. So, overall, would not highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Loved the Orchard!
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my recent stay at Orchard. The front desk attendants were very helpful. The hotel room was also very spacious and comfortable, and the hotel location was great. I would definitely choose Orchard again if my travel plans brought me back to San Francisco.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Was impressed by this hotel and it lived up to the expectations noted in previous reviews. From the warm welcome upon arrival to answering any concerns and travel queries we had the staff were always very helpful and professional in their manner. The rooms are comfortable though the noise from the garbage trucks in the middle of the night did disrupt my sleep . Our second check in to this hotel we were placed in a room facing Bush Street and this proved much quieter - would recommend this . Beds very comfortable and plenty of hot water for the shower. Very easy to get on a cable car - a few steps from the hotel and walking distance to China Town, Union Square and bars and restaraunts.

review.title: Great Staff!
review.reviewText: This is a friendly well managed hotel and we thought it excellent value for the price. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. The location, right beside the Powell cable car line and a few blocks from Union Square, is very convenient. We ate several times at the restaurant in the hotel -- which is quite good -- but sometimes they need more staff in the restaurant - it can be very busy at breakfast and dinner time for just one waiter or waitress.

review.title: Superb service
review.reviewText: We arrived early, but were able to check in straight away, much appreciated after a 13 hour overnight flight. The room was very comfortable, quiet and well furnished. The only complaint, and it's minor, was that there was no tea available in the room, only coffee. The location is very convenient to Union Square and the financial district/Chinatown. Reception staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. All in all, an excellent hotel that deserves it's high rating.

review.title: Unbeatable value for a San Francisco vacation.
review.reviewText: We loved San Francisco. People were very friendly. Great multi-cultural experience with Chinatown, Italian ambiance in North Beach, etc. Local public transportation is wonderful. Avoid the hordes of tourists at Fisherman's Wharf - there is much more to see - the Golden Gate Bridge, Ocean Beach, Pacific Heights, Yerba Buena Park, South Beach and the Bay Bridge, Telegraph Hill. Be sure to take layers of clothing and adapt to daily variations in temperature.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We've enjoyed our stays at the Orchard Hotel for the last 2 years, but note that they state you might get 2 queen beds or one king. My husband and I got a room with 2 queens, (though they were undersized, more like oversized twins). However, at our request, the manager moved us into a room with a king bed the next day for the rest of our stay. The hotel is clean, the staff efficient, and the location is great.

review.title: Reasonable priced hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: A good hotel if you want to stay in the Union Square area. Reasonably priced for the location . The staff was friendly. The room was a bit dark, and not very attractive. The facilities are a little tired. It does not have the amenities of a larger chain hotel.

review.title: Great Little Hotel!
review.reviewText: Our room was spacious, comfortable and very clean. The front desk staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel is conveniently located, steps to Union Square, Chinatown and many good restaurants and the cable car stops just outside the hotel entrance. My hustand and I enjoyed our stay at The Orchard Hotel and would certainly stay there again.

review.title: We found that the Orchard Hotel staff are friendly and that the hotel well located.
review.reviewText:
The Orchard hotel is located on Bush St, above union square, where the streets are quite steep - which could be an issue for, older less fit travellers, who intend walking. But of course many hotels in San Francisco would be similarly located on steep streets.

The room at the Orchard was comfortable and perfectly adequate.

We found that the meals at the Daffodil Restaurant in the hotel to be good value and reasonably priced.

review.title: Good hotel. Just make sure you have the right one!
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Good location. Just be careful that there are 2 hotels with similar names in the same vicinity (Orchard hotel and Orchard Garden hotel). Make sure you specify the exact address of the hotel that you are staying at. Told the cab driver which hotel I was staying at and he seemed to know which one I was talking about. I didn't realise that I was at the wrong hotel until I tried to check in. Had pay for another taxi to drive me to the correct hotel. Was quite annoying. Even though the 2 hotels are quite close to each other the hills and my luggage made it impossible to walk to the other hotel. Otherwise, my stay was fine.

review.title: A very convenient and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the overall comfort and convenience of this hotel. The room was a good size and the beds were comfortable. We enjoyed being close to the cable car line as well as Union Square. This meant that we were close to shopping, restaurants and public transit. It was nice to have a DVD player in the room and a selection of DVD's to borrow from the office. Our only complaint was a plumbing problem that resulted in some showers going cold. We were compensated with some 'Express Breakfast' passes and not being charged for some local phone calls. I would stay here again.

review.title: Jasmine
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful Hotel with a great staff.

review.title: Nothing fancy
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay, nothing fancy. The facet drain cap came off and the spout was loose.The bathroom door was misaligned and part of the wallpaper was peeling along with telephone transformer loosely held by a zip tie.I guess expected the hotel to be in better condition.

review.title: Quiet at night.
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night and 1st time visitors to S/F, I was not impressed with the city. It was a little dim and quiet sleeping city.

review.title: Comfortable and relaxed
review.reviewText: Had a great time, very friendly, wonderful location, beautiful room, service was wonderful, thank you

review.title: traveler form San Diego
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, affordable price, and great location.

review.title: Great location, great price
review.reviewText: Felt it was a very convenience and centrally located location. Right on cable car line. Rate was on special so that was an added bonus. If you drive, it's not cheap to park your car - two nights for the car equaled one night for us in the hotel.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, really nice. Great front desk.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: Great central location and a friendly helpful staff!

review.title: Perfect San Fran location
review.reviewText: A trolley right outside, minutes walk to Union Sq and Embarcadero and wonderful smaller restaurants - Orchard is the perfect location.

review.title: Perfect Getaway!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great and convenient location to public transportation...good exercise to get up the hill!

review.title: Great location, great price, great hotel!
review.reviewText:
I'm a chain hotel kinda girl, but recently I've been dabbling in boutique hotels. This was a successful dabble! The hotel is clean, the beds are uber-comfy, the staff is very nice. The central location makes it easy to walk to almost any part of the city. I know some people complain about the hills, but the fact is that in SF you're either at the top of the hill or the bottom, right? Flat is very hard to find.

I was pleased to find a nice hotel < hundred in the city, although with parking that price goes higher. It's rather funny that it costs half as much to park my car for the night as it does to park myself for the night, but the Orchard's parking prices are by no means out of line with the rest of the city.

I will definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

review.title: First visit to SF in 24 years
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, quiet and close to numerous points of interests. The staff was professional and friendly. The door men were always helpful to my "in-town" family when short term parking was needed. I did not experiance the hotel resturant, as we had plans everynight with family. Next visit I intend to have a least one meal there. I would stay here again on my next visit.

review.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel.
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel has great service, is conveniently located, and cares about the environment. I stayed at the Orchard for a long weekend in San Francisco and was really impressed by this hotel. Very comfortable beds. Nice quality of linens. Very quiet and immaculately clean. Front desk staff is welcoming and helpful. I'm looking forward to staying here again!

review.title: Very impressive Nob Hill hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard Hotel in Nob Hill for one night in May 2010 and absolutely loved it - we walked quickly from Montgomery BART (10 minutes with a slight bit of hill at the end, it being Nob Hill...) and checked in early by 30 minutes but the room was ready for us and was really lovely, with a big double bed, lush bedding, thick double glazing so no street noise which was key, a big tv, free DVDs (and a huge, good selection), and very nice, large bathroom with tub. The receptionists were polite, friendly and efficient. We walked up through Nob Hill to Grace Cathedral for some sight-seeing and then to North Beach for some delicious Italian food and back again later that evening - no cabs needed. You couldn't do that in heels mind, but with sandals or trainers no problem.

review.title: Excellent hotel on a modest budget
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service, the front desk always goes out of their way. the restaurant satff is very friendly- good food. Central location close to all the fun things. I love the hotel.

review.title: Best SF hotel we've stayed in
review.reviewText: Staff were consistently friendly and helpful. Room was attractive, bed was wonderful, shower was great (not that easy to find these days), services most satisfactory. We'll make it a point to stay here again.

review.title: Exceptionally pleasant medium-size hotel in center of the city
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying in this hotel because of the pleasant staff, attractive and very comfortable-but not luxurious-rooms, comfortable beds, and its very manageable size. I would recommend a room on the higher floors, which are quieter and sunnier. The hotel has a good location midway between Union Square and Nob Hill and a few blocks from both. Also within easy walking distance of the financial district and Chinatown and many restaurants. The hotel has a dining room, which is attractive and comfortable and the food was quite good on several occasions. Here, the only disappointment was the mediocre service ---the sole, overburdened waiter was unable to serve orders in a timely and professional manner (he kept forgetting things.) If the service were to improve dramatically, I could recommend the restaurant.

review.title: Green hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Though they don't honor third party reservations (they changed my room accommodations from what I had booked) it was a nice hotel in a good location.

review.title: Great for Shoppers, not for Golden Gate Park visitors
review.reviewText:
The hotel quality and condition is excellent. Its location caters to shopper in the Union Square district. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. They offer wonderful organic amenities. The room is roomy and has a wet bar. Hugh bathroom. The location is noisy especially if your room is in the back. I was awatken at 12:15 am by the trash truck. The second night by trash can rolling about. Needless to say, I didn't sleep well at all.

If you drive, valet parking is $40/night. The wait can take 15-25 mins to get your car. Everything is expensive. Chinatown is two blocks away. I stayed in the wrong location because my interest was toward the Golden State park area.

review.title: Great Value at the Orchard
review.reviewText:
The Orchard Hotel for me was very reasonably priced and exceeded my expectations for my mission of an overnight stay in SF. The staff heated up my soup in the staff kitchen. They were very helpful and let me park out front for 1/2 hr free.

If you go to this hotel in a car, there is a reasonably priced parking garage to the east about 1.5 blocks away on the same road as the hotel. It is much cheaper than the Orchards valet parking service. My guess is the hotel uses the same garage down the street for valet parking, as there is very little other parking in the area.

No views from the hotel, but you can't go wrong with this one. Two thumbs way up for the price.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Really nice staff, great hotel, right in the city center, very clean and confortable

review.title: A very good hotel for a great price
review.reviewText:
We had a great price with expedia last minute deal.
The hotel room was great for this price, comfortable and quiet (you may have to ask for a quiet room). Cable car stops a few yards away from the hotel, that's really neat.
We will stay at his hotel next time we come to SF.

review.title: Chic, Sophisticated & Upscale Hotel - an excellent experience
review.reviewText: The rooms were large and elegantly apportioned - urban chic would be an appropriate descriptor. Staff was friendly and courteous. Had an unforseen delay in my travel plans, necessitating pushing back my arrival in SF by one day. The hotel graciously accommodated me by changing my reservations without additional charge. Would, without qualification, recommend the hotel.

review.title: very good SF choice
review.reviewText: good location, good lobby and acceptable room. Noise wasn't as bad as I had been told as I took a rear facing room. Excellent location for walking tours and catching the trolleys. No real view from the hotel and neighborhood is a little seedy but never felt in danger. Desk help could have been better in knowing the surrounding restaurants. I would recommend this to anyone.

review.title: pleasant surprise for san fran rookies
review.reviewText:
I had not been to SF in decades and was leery about booking a hotel I didn't know while traveling with my teenage son as he auditioned for theatre colleges, but our experience at this hotel could not have been more delightful. The staff was welcoming, helpful and friendly. Our corner room was lovely and the bathroom was huge for a hotel; love the "bathroomities". We felt safe in the hotel and the neighborhood.
The room was very clean and the beds were comfy.
I would love to stay here again. If you find a good price online, don't hesitate to book this. We were very satisfied with our stay.

review.title: Eager to stay here again--what a find!
review.reviewText: All of the staff members we encountered, from the front desk, to the doorman and housekeeping staff, were very friendly and helpful. It surprised me a little, as I thought a hotel in the city might be impersonal, but I was glad to be proven wrong on that point. The location was great--walking distance from the Powell Street BART and MUNI station (only the last block up to the hotel is very steep, the rest are just moderately so), and literally a few steps away from the cable car line. Our room was clean and comfortable with nice toiletries and linens, and everything was in fine working order. Free in-room internet access, and even some San Francisco guidebooks and magazines to browse. The bed was super comfortable, too. What more could one ask for a weekend getaway in San Francisco?

review.title: Great value, great service
review.reviewText: The service was extremely attentive and courteous. The only minor glitch was trouble I had with the free wireless service. But when I called about it, someone on the staff came within about 5 minutes with a cable.

review.title: A great little hotel.
review.reviewText: We spent four days exploring San Francisco, and can't imagine a better hotel as a base. The rooms have a lot of character. The staff is pleasant and knowledgeable. And the location is ideal -- 30 yards from the cable car that takes you to the heart of down-town (and the other excellent public transportation) and to Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Excellent choice!
review.reviewText: If "green" means "welcome," this this, San Francisco's first green hotel is one of the most hospitable I've stayed in. The hotel is spotless; the staff courteous and extremely helpful, and the amenities first rate. The location is perfect for those travelling to San Francisco for business or personal purposes. It's now a "must stay" hotel on my list.

review.title: Great value, especially for the location. Heavenly Bed-ish!
review.reviewText: The bed was great with the feel of "heavenly beds". The blonde wood furniture was a litlte dated, but that was the only thing that I would have changed in the room. The hotel amenities are sparse but that wasn't what I was there for, so it was a perfect for a nice room at a good value in a great location.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: I heard about this hotel from a colleague and was pleasantly surprised. Based on the surrounding neighborhood, this would not have been my first choice but now I would not hesitate recommending it to others.

review.title: A gem in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: On the outside and in the hallways, the hotel looked ordinary and a bit old. Inside my room, however, everything was clean, surprisingly roomy, comfortable and did not feel or look old at all. The hotel staff were consistently friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. It was an easy walk to Market street, Chinatown, Union Square and the convention center.

review.title: The best of choices
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent. It was a lovely quiet and charming hotel. The room was large, nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable, everything was clean and pretty and the staff was lovely whenever we needed something. We were very happy with our choice, would strongly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we go back to San Francisco. The hotel is placed in an excellent spot, two blocks away from downtown, half a block from a tram stop, you have a starbucks on the next block, lots of shops, a few nice restaurants, a laundromat which is useful if youve been travelling around for some time. The fitness room was a bit poor, but I didnt care that much since the hotel was excellent.

review.title: A great boutique hotel option in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff at the Orchid Hotel are very friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are lovely, well-equipped, much more spacious than those at competitor boutique holels that we have stayed in in San Francisco. The wifi is free and very fast. Breakfast is expensive if not on the B and B package, but Starbucks and two great breakfast places are only a block away. Ditto with parking - use the Sutter Stockton garage and not the valet parking. Very close by and much cheaper than valet (plus the wait for the car to be brought around was often lengthy the two days we used it). The cable car is right on the corner (and easier to squeeze on than waiting in line at the PoweIl and Market turn-around) and fun to hear it clanging from the room. Union Square is one block (down a steep hill). I would definitely return to the Orchid.

review.title: Orchard SF
review.reviewText: Very nice boutique hotel. Great staff. Excellent combo deal on Expedia.

review.title: Roomier than the Orchard Garden
review.reviewText: Room was comfortable, and fairly spacious for the price. Nice bed, good choice of pillows. Since we were up on the 4th floor, the street noise was not too bad. Drawbacks- bathroom, although large, has no tub. Shower is quite roomy, but the door didn't open well- very stiff and the hinges sounded like they would break every time it was opened. When we arrived, the handle on the shower door was broken. We asked to have it fixed, and got quick response. Odd that they did not pay attention to the fact that it still made the cracking noise when they fixed it, though. Other than that, only other shortcoming was that there is only a small soapdish in the shower, so no place to put shampoo, etc, other than the floor! We liked the hotel overall, and would stay there again. Since they do supply newspapers daily, it would be nice to have a place to recycle them.

review.title: Prime Location in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were very pleased with the location of the Orchard in San Francisco. Union Square and China Town were both within easy walking distance of the hotel, and we found plenty of places in the area to eat and shop. As for the hotel itself, we were both pleased with the hotel and its amenities during our overnight stay. We were less pleased with the hotel's parking arrangements (guests use public parking and the hotel does not valid parking).

All in all, my wife and I were happy with our stay at the Orchard Hotel and are thinking of staying there again for Chinese New Year.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Orchard Hotel is ANYTHING but Boutique or worth yoiur money
review.reviewText: I have traveled all over the world for almost 30 years. Even in remote areas I've had better hotels. If you have ANY need for Internet service, forget this place. Their service discinnects you about every 2 minutes, sometimes comes right back and sometimes wait an hour. I told the desk clerk, her answers were A. use a cable and B. its the most complained about thing and we keep telling the GM but he doesn't do anything. We arrived late, told desk for a 9:00AM wake up call. At 5:30AM they called! I came in at 3:30AM on check out day (I was in for biz and a big family wedding my last night) and asked for a 10:00AM wake-up. The bellman called at 8:00AM to tell me my car was here. I hadn't ordered a car! Oops, wrong room room was the reply. Room service a VERY limited menu from restaurant is way overpriced even by SF standards. Room info says from 3:00PM to 10:00PM. I called at 3:00PM to order a late lunch had to argue with the person who insisted room service started at 5:00PM. He finally agreed to ask and came back and said, yes it was 3:00PM and I could order. Another day I put out clean up room sign at 9:00AM. When I returned at 3:00PM it still wasn't made up. And it only gets worse, such as no in room movies, no HBO or other premium channels and more, but I'm running out of room. What tells it all about this hotel and its lack of conern is that the comment card requires the guest to put a stamp on it if you want to mail it. STAY AWAY! STAY AWAY! STAY AWAY!

review.title: WONDERFUL HOTEL
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found it to be very quiet, and very clean. The room was very comfortable and had a large bathroom. The staff was very friendly and went out of there way to be helpfull. We asked for and received a high floor. The hotel was very easy to find and centrally located. We can not comment on the diningroom as we never ate there.

review.title: everything is fine
review.reviewText: good location plus quality and nice staff

review.title: What a Find!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a boutique style and it has charm. It's in a great centralized location and a wonderfully helpful staff. I was extremely satisfied with my choice in this hotel.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Very little to fault. Car parking not great or cheap, but its in San Francisco centre, so as you would expect.

review.title: wonderful stay!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel.Great location.Cable car line steps away.Central to many shops and restaurants.Had a high floor,so no noise issues.Front desk staff was super friendly and helpful.Didn't try the restaurant.Seemed kind of pricey but then we found out,all eating in San Fran. is expensive.Paid room in advance,so great rate.Would defineatley recommend this hotel

review.title: Over the Top
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a quiet, reasonable, very well kept hotel with the most courteous and helpful staff, the Orchard is the place! Parking is the only problem for any place in SF, so don't bring a car. Cable car is a short walk from the hotel and it makes easy connections with BART buses to take you anywhere. We were so pleased with the Orchard. Its a find!

review.title: Comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and mostly quiet for sleeping. The staff were friendly and helpful. Good location for Union Square and trolley.

review.title: Will stay here again !!
review.reviewText: Great place !! Had a great time, very central. Cable car was very handy, used the bus system also. Room clean, personel fantastic !

review.title: I will go back.
review.reviewText: I will return,I rented a car and did not really use it. I was in the middle of everything.

review.title: Good base would stay again
review.reviewText: We found the Orchard a good base to explore the city. Good sized room. Quiet and air con worked well and not too noisy. Doorman very helpful. Breakfast ok if in a hurry but good one at Roxanne's on the corner nearby.

review.title: A great hotel
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel, really good location just up from Union Square. Excellent staff, friendly and helpful. The room was clean, well equipped and very comfortable.

review.title: Great boutique hotel close to union square. Comfy beds and staff very helpful
review.reviewText: Close to union square. the room was great. Bed comfortable and thick donnas. room very clean. Satff helpful and doormen also helpful. Free Dvds to watch if you want. cable Tv also. Would come again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Great Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, quiet and stylish. The rooms were very nicely decorated and the bathroom was large, clean and attractive. This hotel is a fantastic value for the money. My only negative is that the matresses were very soft.

review.title: I will go back, definitely!
review.reviewText: Centered near Union square and Japantown, Orchard Hotel's location is strategically placed! You could either go shopping or walk down to Japantown to have some delicious sushi! The overall room and service was beyond satisfactory. The only downside I can think of is that the price of the room does not include breakfast.. so we had to hunt for breakfast on our own! Overall it is a little pricey but it is totally worth it!

review.title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel in Heart of SF
review.reviewText: I hesitate to gush too much, but this hotel is a little treasure. Just below Nob Hill it's within easy strolling distance to the Embarcadero, Union Square, Market Street, South of Market and you can catch a cable car ride outside the lobby. There are enough little restaurants right on Bush Street that you wouldn't be able to sample in a week. The staff is wonderful and attentive. As another reviewer mentioned the bathroom is huge. The bed is luxurious. I particularly like eating breakfast in the restaurant with the sounds of jazz and the cable car in the background.

review.title: Terrific Hotel Terrific Location
review.reviewText: As a native SF, who now lives in MT, going back is always a joy. Finding a comfortable, reasonable and centrally located place to stay is not. Hotel Orchard is in a fantastic location (right across the street from Masa's, one of my favorite restaurants) close to Union Sq and Nob Hill, the bed was comfortable, the room quiet, and the amenities lovely. People were helpful and even told us (though we already knew it) that the most reasonable parking was at the Stockton St. Garage. ($24) Parking charges were the only unpleasant thing about the hotel ($40-$50 a night) but we were able to find on the street parking. Only other minor comment: no views. But you can't have everything for the price we paid. I would return again, no question. Alexis

review.title: I will stay at this hotel again and recommend it to my family & friends!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel, off the beaten path but in close walking proximity to Union Square, Chinatown, etc. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay immensely. Very quiet, clean and friendly atmosphere. Would definitely look them up again for future SF trips!

review.title: Great stay at spacious Orchard
review.reviewText: Huge room by San Fran standards, perfect location walking distance to attractions.

review.title: Great location, friendly place
review.reviewText: Did not have our requested room so they upgraded us to a suite! Very responsive staff, always greeted us at the door, location central to many beautiful sites.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in PERFECT location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is comfortable, immaculate, great beds and high quality bed linens. The room was quite large compared to other similar hotels in the area. Free WiFi in the rooms which is RARE in mid town San Francisco. I loved the fact that the cable cars were right on the corner of the hotel which is fabulous is you have any trouble navigating all the big hills walking around city. Many restaurants available close by and the hotel restaurant was nice too, though kind of pricey. One negative was parking at the hotel...$40 per night. We didn't rent a car so it didn't matter to us. Skip the car rental and use the convenient public transportation.

review.title: Very impressive hotel
review.reviewText: The beds were fantastic. Comfortable quiet rooms and friendly staff. Great location near Union Square and Chinatown. The have a DVD library(free) and a DVD in each room. They also have a mini fridge and various items in there for a charge, but we didn't buy anything. I would definitely stay here again for the right price.

review.title: Great location, great deal!
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my stay at The Orchard. I actually work for a competing hotel company and originally booked through them, but found a better deal online at this hotel and switched my reservations. I didn't have high expectations for the price, but was pleasantly surprised by the size, cleanliness and comfort of the room, as well as by the convenient location to shopping and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, calm and comfortable
review.reviewText: A short walk up from Union Square, directly by the Powell St cable car and nevertheless a reasonably quiet and very comfortable hotel. Much recommended.

review.title: Quiet and Convenient
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel surpassed our expectations which were already quite high after reading the Expedia reviews. Our room was in the front of the hotel facing Bush street and yet was very quiet despite the proximity to Powell Street and the cable cars. The location of the hotel is convenient as it avoids the noise of Union Square yet is only 2 blocks away. In addition, the Grant Street entrance to Chinatown is a mere 2 blocks to the east on Bush Street. The room size was adequate and the bathroom was clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable with excellent pillows. Overall, the hotel provided an excellent base for sightseeing with a quiet night's rest guaranteed at the end of a busy day. I would definitely stay at the Orchard again.

review.title: Very nice stay......
review.reviewText: Hotel manager was very accomadating and the staff was extremely friendly. The bathroom was probably the biggest I've seen in san francisco and the bedroom was more than I had expected. Very sad to leave but would definetly come back again. Loved it!!!

review.title: Decent hotel at decent price
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean and beds were comfortable but thin walls- could hear people talking next door. Liked the free DVD rentals at the front desk. Just a couple of blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Good but used to be great
review.reviewText: Staff aren't as friendly as they used to be and the hotel is starting to show it's age.

review.title: Easy, convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: Had a lengthy stay at the Orchard Hotel -- 11 nights. It was comfortable and lovely, I would definitely stay there again. My bed was very comfortable (after I asked for the plastic mattress overlay to be removed, which it was without comment) and the housekeeping service was great. I was greeted warmly each time I came and went, but otherwise left alone, which was nice. The room wasn't huge and had no view to speak of, but it was certainly large enough not to be claustrophobic and had plenty of natural light. I was near the elevators, but I can't say I was ever bothered by noise -- it was incredibly quiet and restful. Only downside I can see is the steep walk up the hill!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful boutique hotel, exceptionally maintained and clean. Helpful staff, quiet rooms, the location was perfect for sightseeing SF. Will stay at the Orchard Hotel again on any return trips.

review.title: Not as good as expected!
review.reviewText: We read glowing reviews about this hotel before travelling to San Francisco so we had high expectations. The first room we were taken to had a very musty smell, we complained and were immediately taken to a new room. The second room was fine but the room creaked quite loudly during the night and there was a fair amount of traffic noise. The wireless internet was not great and kept on dropping out. The staff were great, very helpful and the hotel is well situated, walking distance to most major attractions.

review.title: Hot water problems
review.reviewText: Good location close to Powell cable car. Room a bit tired but with nice bathroom. However, during our 4 night stay there the shower was often cold in the morning, and despite assurances the water system was being fixed it never got any better.

review.title: POOR SERVICE
review.reviewText: Don't stay here. Unhelpful staff and uncomfortable beds.

review.title: Great Stay !
review.reviewText: Always feel welcome by the warm service of the helpful staff. Near the city center yet assured of a quiet rest after a day's outing. My preferred stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Good Hotel -- Great Price.
review.reviewText: We stayed over the Bay to Breakers weekend. Somehow I managed to get a pretty good deal through expedia as the rates were considerably higher a few weeks later. This is the second time we've stayed at the hotel and we've enjoyed our stay both times. Bonuses: location, price, free wireless internet, late checkout (allowed this time), comfy beds, quiet. Negative -- no pool.

review.title: Very nice stay
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights middle of May. The room was very large, compared to European size rooms we are used to. Very comfortable and quiet (8th floor). We overlooked roofs so the view was not fantastic but who cares. We were visiting San Francisco, not staying in the room all day long. Very clean room and bathroom. We took a breakfast one day and it was good. Staff was very friendly and helpful during all our stay. Very well located for all touristic locations. 50 meters away from cable car to Fisherman's wharf, less than 5 minutes from Union Square.

review.title: Nice resonable place to stay
review.reviewText: great beds

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Love this hotel and their staff!

review.title: Would return and recommend to a friend,indeed!
review.reviewText: Very good location (close to Powell Street cable car stop and only 4 blocks from Market Street). Room is clean and good. Breakfast not included and only available at the hotel restaurante however, very expensive... Lobby attendants very friendly and helpful when requested. Very good, price is fair, excelent location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great value, walking distance from the financial district and a quick cable car ride to the wharf. The staff were courteous and very helpful, and the room was cozy, clean and perfect for a couple overnight stays.

review.title: Never would have known about this place
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a great rate. I would normally go after the more well known brands but someone local to SF suggested I try it out. They were having a promo that I found through expedia and was I sure glad I tried it. Great staff who always greeted us with a smile. Will go back for sure

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Our goal in SF included each of the following and so this hotel served us perfectly. It was just two blocks down the street to Chinatown, 2 blocks down to Union Square, and a brisk walk from the Orpheum took about 20 minutes. (We had the porter get us a taxi to take us there.) We arrived fairly early with the hope they would allow us to check in early which they did. Valet parking was E40 plus taxes but this seemed more reasonable than paying E37 at the nearby garage as using the car was not necessary during our one night stay. The staff were most friendly, helpful and efficient. The room was comfortable, spacious and had all the features we needed: TV, free wifi, robes, toiletries, extra pillows, writing desk, lighting, (and didn't need - mini bar, safe, DVD player, CD player, wardrobes, vanity mirrors). We did not have a view as our room backed up onto another building but even that building had ornate architectural features so we it was not a total drawback. We did not eat at the hotel or frequent the bar but their availability was a plus. Also, a separate temperature control was in the room to either heat or cool and both worked well - I tested them to see if the worked but turned them off as they were not necessary during our stay. Checkout was also very efficient, with the porter collecting our bags and having our car retrieved. I am not supposed to quote our rate on here but I would definitely stay again if able to get a reduced rate using Expedia.

review.title: I approve!
review.reviewText: I was so impressed and pleased with this hotel! The room, bathroom included, was quite large for San Francisco; very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The features offered were a wonderful addition to the stay. The staff were all so friendly, and they remembered us every time we entered/exited. The doorman was always on top of things and had a genuine smile every time we saw him. He retrieved our car immediately when requested, and even offered to load our bags into the car for us! The location is perfect, with easy access to everything. I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Very satisfied with this hotel
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel based on the great reviews and the fact that there was free Internet access and we were not disappointed. The hotel is clean, the bed was large with very soft bedding and the bathroom was spacious with lovely bath products and fluffy towels. The room was not huge but this is not something we really care about - there was more than enough space for our stuff. The location is excellent for tourists. The staff were helpful and courteous and able to answer all our questions. We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that. There's a laptop in the lobby and we used it to book our Alcatraz tour (the staff let us print our e-tickets at no charge). We were glad to have our own laptop, though, as we were able to look up directions to various places on the MUNI (public transit) web site and read restaurant reviews. Only a couple of small negative points: you are right downtown so if you are a light sleeper you'll likely hear garbage trucks going by in the early morning if your room faces the back alleyway - it's not extremely loud but definitely audible. Also, the first night the fridge in our mini-bar made a high-pitched humming sound which was rather annoying but it seemed to go away after that, or else I simply got used to it. The hotel has a quasi-Art Deco theme so don't expect sleek, minimalist furnishings.

review.title: Excellent boutique hotel at good price
review.reviewText: Large room, extremely comfortable bed, good service - excellent 1-night weekend stay

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Orchard for 4 nights. this Hotels is in the heart of everything. A block away is Union Square, the Ferry Building is a quick 15 walk, the entrance to China Town is a block away, the trolley for Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf picks up right at the corner......perfect location. The hotel itself was surprisingly really nice for the deal. It was clean, quiet, etc. Hotel staff was very accomadating and helpful. They helped with ALL of our questions on getting around and seeing the sights. The bed was comfortable and the linens were just as nice as what you would find in a fancier, upscale hotel. I will definitely stay there again!

review.title: Home Away from Home!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel over the past 7 years and have NEVER been disappointed! The rooms are so clean and the beds are heavenly. I love a small boutique hotel where you can get to know the people at the restaurant and doorman and everyone is helpful with suggestions for restaurants and activities.

review.title: Excellent SF venue
review.reviewText: I like the Orchard Hotel, especially because it is convenient, comfortable and seismically safe (an important quality in SF). The staff is very helpful and the overall environs quite appealing. I stay at the Orchard whenever I need a hotel in the Bay Area.

review.title: The room was great and the service was excellent
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable and clean. I thought the service was also very good. While the hotel was very close to Union Square and the main shopping area, the hill-climb up the last block on Powell was a bit daunting. However, all in all, the hotel was an excellent value which I would recommend to anyone who needs this location.

review.title: very clean and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at The Orchard Hotel in San Francisco. It was very clean, the staff was extremely courteous and helpful. It is in a GREAT location - just a couple blocks from Chinatown in one direction and Union Square in the other - right on the cable car line. Very nice stay and if we ever get back to San Francisco, we will stay there again.

review.title: Great Value for Price
review.reviewText: I got a great price on this hotel room and was extremely happy with cleanliness and location.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Staff is friendly and helpful. Nice (free)perks, e.g., fruit basket at front desk, umbrellas available (SF is Rainy!), dvds available for room. Room was nice size and bed was comfortable. The shower only provides cold water between 6 am and 9 am. Connected restaurant seemed overpriced. We did not eat there for that reason ($18 pp continental bfast). Chinatown is a few blocks away. Tunnel Top bar just east of the hotel is great! Bartenders are friendly and drinks are reasonably priced. Only Negative: After checkout, we commented to the conceierge we needed a cab to the airport. He rounded up their towncar and stated it would be the same price as a cab. Not true. We arrived by taxicab from the airport for $35 plus tip. At the airport the driver indicated the ride was $50 plus $3 airport fee, add in driver and conceirge gratuity and that equals $70! Overall, the Hotel is very nice, my wife and I were certainly stay there again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for business trip. Great location, friendly staff, confortable room.

review.title: Sanctuary in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my two day stay at the Orchard Hotel and I'd be happy to stay there again. The accomidations were comfortable and clean. The location excellent and the hotel staff very professional. Maybe a bit too much as I went out for dinner and found the maid straighting out my bed sheets after they had cleaned the room earlier.

review.title: small but impressive
review.reviewText: Great location on Powell st cable car line, comfortable room, friendly service

review.title: quiet, convenient, affordable
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for a quick stopover in SF. I had requested a room that was both quiet and had good light, and were given exactly that. We had a wonderful nights sleep with nice linens and comfortable beds. We did not eat at the hotel. A glance at the breakfast bar didn't entice but we heard bar & dinners are good. The front desk staff was very friendly. It all felt "just right", nothing overdone, not too expensive, not too much of anything - just understated and comfortable, I would stay again.

review.title: Orchard is great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Orchard is a well run, very clean, very functional perfectly located San Francisco hotel.

review.title: Great Location. Good value.
review.reviewText: Would go there again. Very recommended.

review.title: Comfortable stay.
review.reviewText: Good location, convenient to Union Square and environs. Front staff mostly helpful, but not very good at local restaurant recommendations. Room very quite nice, plenty of room to spread out. Would go back.

review.title: Completely satisfied
review.reviewText: Its a gem of a find. I thoroughly enjoyed this modestly sized property. The staff was attentive and professional and the room was spotless, quiet and comfortable, what more could you ask for? I highly recommend this location and I will return.

review.title: A good choice
review.reviewText: A nice boutique hotel that is clean and well maintained and very affordable. It is also 2 blocks from Chinatown and 2 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Kept Secret
review.reviewText: As a frequent traveller to San Francisco, this is my 1st time staying with Orchard Hotel. To my surprise, the size of the room and the bathroom are big and elegant in decor. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is also great, just a couple of blocks from Union Square. I will definitely stay here again and also recommend to anyone travelling to Sfo.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: This newer hotel is very clean and comfortable. Located walking distance from many desirable locations made this a great place to stay. Affordable overnight parking could be found just 1/2 block away. We definately will be returning to the Orchard Hotel.

review.title: Wow! Great Place from which to Enjoy SF
review.reviewText: The staff was super friendly and courteous. They genuinely want you to enjoy the facility and the City. Small things like newspapers (free), wi-fi (free), fruit (free), current DVDs to use in your room (free), extra pillows and umbrellas (it rained) add up to a lot. The rooms are clean and fresh. You can get anywhere from the hotel via bus, trolley or cable car. The staff will whip out a map and tell you how to get anywhere.

review.title: A very nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I found the Orchard Hotel to be an excellent quality hotel both in its amenities & service. On top of that has an umbeatable location being a mere 2 blocks away from Union Square. All in all a wining proposition.

review.title: Couldn't be happier
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with excellent and helpful staff

review.title: Great location, Nice rooms
review.reviewText: Great value for a prime location. Staff was friendly and offered helpful advice (just not willing to secure tickets, etc for you). Room was very comfortable, clean and well decorated. Lobby space was non-existent, but overall very satisfied with stay. Would recommend and would go back

review.title: Unassuming wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is located a few blocks from Union Square, and about a 10 minute cab ride from the Ferry building; taxi from the airport was about a 30-minute ride and cost ~$40. WiFi is free in-room. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the linens were crisp and clean. My room did not have a beautiful view, as it faced inward, but it was extremely quiet, and the temperature and humidity were well controlled. My room was soundproof; I did not hear a single clang from the trolleys, which was not the case when I stayed at the superluxury hotel around the corner that charged triple and $15/day for wi-fi. Tile in the bathroom and bedroom carpeting was more like you would find in a custom home, as were the fixtures. I loved this hotel, as I felt I was in someone's fine home, not a hotel at all. The TV was not a flat screen, but the armoire was lovely, and the surround sound added a nice touch (especially when listening to the relaxation CD they provided). The only item missing was a frig, but this may be the reason the carpeting and room were in such good condition. Free oranges in the lobby.

review.title: Great location, big rooms, very quiet, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great hotel for business travelers. This hotel is near the financial district and about 5 blocks from the San Francisco Information Center building and the BART stop at Powell and Market (under the mall and near the trolley hub). This BART line will take you to and from SFO (Airport). There is a Good Italian restaurant - Uncle Vito's - across the street from the hotel on the corner and the trolley car stops 50 feet from the hotel's front door. Hotel is very clean and has friendly service. Hotel restaurant is rarely crowded and they give out free morning papers and there is free internet in the lobby (but it's not in a private area and print outs are $.50 per page). Walking distance to Chinatown and North Beach. This hotel is not close to major sites like Fisherman's Warf, Market Street shopping (trolley is easiest way to get there) or the Golden Gate Bridge (bus). Overall good experience with this hotel.

review.title: An Outstanding Hotel
review.reviewText: This is an outstanding small hotel just off the beaten path, not far from Union Square. Far enough away from the hubbub to be peaceful, but close enough to be a stroll (if you can stroll on the hills of SF) to your destination, or to public transportation to take you to your destination. The venue is very attractive, clean, and up to date. The staff is extremely pleasant and helpful. The amenities are top rate. Unlike large corporate hotels, the Orchard had a very personal feel which made it quite special.

review.title: No Hot Water
review.reviewText: After checking in I was told they would not have any hot water in the morning due to repairs. My response was, Gee if I knew that I would have gone somewhere else, That's fine but we will still charge you!

review.title: Very friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Orchard is a very nice, clean and friendly hotel. Our room was very confortable but our view was not great.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Orchard Garden Hotel is in a prime location just steps away from Chinatown Gate, a few blocks away from Union Square where all the shopping is, and a 5 min taxi ride to the ferry building. The hotel is clean, cosy and staff are friendly. You also get free Wi-Fi connection which is always a bonus!

review.title: One of the best hotels I stayed in
review.reviewText: Recently remodeled, very clean, large rooms (I stayed in King Suite). The only problem I had was vinyl stain-protection mattress pad. After sweating for 1 night I removed the sheet from the bed and the rest of my vacation was spectacular.

review.title: Better than a best buy
review.reviewText: While nondescript on the outside, the Orchard is well done on the inside: clean, comfortable, newly & tastefully decorated. The rooms are generously sized and quiet; the bed and bedding are new. The staff are consistently friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great find !!!
review.reviewText: We were stuck in San Frnacisco for 3 days due to flight cancellations. We were lucky to find this great boutique hotel at midnight through Expedia. The service was deendable and the room was clean, crisp and pleasant. The bed was awesome. It's in a great location to walk anywhere. We'll definitely stay there the next time we plan a trip to SF

review.title: Very classy hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Orchard overnight with my girlfriend and we were both very pleased with the service as well as the quality of the rooms. The staff was very accommodating and the location was top notch. I would definitely go there again.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is in a great location, the staff were friendly, helpful and courteous, and our room was very cosy and quiet, overall we couldn't have wished for more! Given the chance we would definitely return to the Orchard.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: This is a very nice boutique hotel in the downtown, just a few steps from Union Square and Chinatown, I can highly recommend it.

review.title: Excellent little hotel with wonderful helpful staff!
review.reviewText: The Orchard is a wonderful place. The staff is very attentive and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable. The location in downtown San Francisco is close to BART station, wonderful restaurants, and cable car routes. I definitely would stay there again.

review.title: Not as green as I hoped
review.reviewText: I loved the Orchard Hotel. The location is great, the service is great, the price is great, it was clean and inviting and warm. I was a bit disappointed at the "green" aspect of the hotel. It was advertised to be green, advocate for recycling, etc. Upon arrival, I saw no recycling bin in my room. I never saw one except one behind the front desk. I read the book about the hotel in the room and found that it was built in a green fashion. Great. But I never found the box that supposedly turned off my lights and turned down my heat when I left. I hung my towel up to indicate that I would reuse it again, and it was replaced. I have to say that it has been replaced at nearly every other hotel I have done this at too, so that is not a big surprise. Overall a great place to stay, but not quite as wonderful as I had hoped in the "reduce, reuse, recycle" category.

review.title: Will Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: This was a very comfortable hotel in a great location just off Union Square. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cable car stop just outside the lobby was very convenient. We loved the quiet low key feel of the hotel, yet enjoyed the busy vibrant city life within easy walking distance.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: This Hotel treated us with great Hospitality from the minute we walked in to the minute we left. They recomended great ideas for our day tours and resteraunts. The room were clean, Large and the bathroom worked great. Plenty of hot water and pressure. It was just the place to stay for a romantic weekend away with my wife and they helped arrange strawberries and champagne in the r4ooms upon our arrival.

review.title: Love the Orchard
review.reviewText: Great little boutique hotel. Very large rooms, great service, nice work out room. Recommend highly.

review.title: Exceptionally Nice Hotel and Staff
review.reviewText: Our first visit to the Orchard Hotel will not be our last. Simply a delightful place to stay. Great neighborhood; easy access to cable cars, buses and Bart; many restaurants nearby; and very friendly staff. My only negative is they only have a laptop computer for Internet access at the front desk - and you stand while using it. A line of people wait to use it - they really need to update their Internet service to two desktop stations with chairs.

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel -- two blocks from Union Square -- was perfect. Our room was spacious, spotless, newly refurbished (excellent mattress and bed linens, in particular), and amazingly quiet. The ability to stroll to dinner at any number of quality restaurants within a 15-minute walking radius of the hotel was delightful. This has to be one of the best understated, undiscovered values in SF.

review.title: Great stay at the Orchard
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at the Orchard Hotel for the second week of Nov 2008. The staff were friendly and accomodating. The rooms were large with a beautiful King size bed with a comfortable duvet and many size pillows for your pick of comfort. Internet and movies were free. Cordless phone for ease of use. Clean and immaculate setting with a big bathroom and Hot shower (well not so hot but tolerable).We were clearly impressed with this Hotel and extremely satisfied with the service and setting. A must stay for family or couple. Thanks Orchard for a great first time visit to San Fran Jon and Jeanne from Canada

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location--the trolley stops practically right outside the entrance. There's a Starbucks right around the corner, where breakfast is a bargain compared to the other restaurants in the area. The room was very clean, the bed very comfortable, and the service great. Get the doorman to book you a car service to the airport when you leave.

review.title: Friendly Staff, Big Rooms, Great Location, Even Better Price
review.reviewText: Got this for an absolute steal on Expedia and would recommend it to anyone going to San Fran. The rooms were large and come complete with DVD player which you can then borrow movies from the hotel for free to watch. Staff were super friendly and offer good dining recommendations and even printed out directions for us to head to the NFL match we had tickets for. Located right on the Powell St cablecar line which takes you to Fishermans Wharf. Walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, shops and restaurants. Can't praise it highly enough.

review.title: Big rooms, great service and location!
review.reviewText: Defintley will return.Very handy having the Alamo/ National drop-off just 100 yards down the road. Service was first class, rooms were spacious,fast internet, and the free DVD's were a nice touch. Highly reccommended and great value.

review.title: Wonderful, relaxing place.
review.reviewText: Very central to shops, chinatown and a tram ride to Fishermans Wharf. Staff very friendly. Fresh fruit provided at reception each morning. Would definately go back and definately book through expedia cheaper rates than hotel direct!

review.title: Very Nice Hotel, Especially for the Price, & Great Location
review.reviewText: Try the neighborhood pizzeria and pasta place across the street. It's a gem of a find for colorful, casual dining and great pizza.

review.title: Definitely worth the price!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and excellent location to Union Square. Our cleaning lady was awesome!

review.title: Most excellent
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was an excellent place to stay. The staff were friendly, responsive, helpful and efficient, the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel is well located, close to Union Square and Chinatown. Highly recommended - top quality service at an extremely competitive price.

review.title: Well located comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed from 11 to 14 August. Hotel is modern with nice rooms, comfortable beds, helpful staff and a great location near the cable car lines and downtown area. Staff provided helpful information and offered to move us when we had a problem with the airconditioning. The 'sleep music' CD was a nice touch. Recommended.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a great location, close to Union Square. Plenty of good restaurants close by. Very good service from the staff in the hotel, buffet breakfast was very good and access to the laptop at reception was very much appreciated.

review.title: Definitely going back
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly staff, good concierge service and advise.

review.title: Great tourist base for seeing SF
review.reviewText: Selected this hotel partly on previous reviews - and glad we did. Bush Street is fairly central (for Downtown SF, Nob Hill etc) and Union Square is only a 5 minute walk. Very helpful staff, good sized rooms and bathrooms, but breakfast not impressive (Roxanne's Cafe around the corner provided reasonable alternative). Restaurant very good but pricey - Uncle Vito's Pasta across the road cheap and excellent but can be busy (although it does their menu on takeaway also).

review.title: Orchard Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, great service, great hotel!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Well located hotel with spacious clean rooms. Just a short walk to Union Square or ride the cable cars (which are great fun)down to Fisherman's Wharf. Staff are helpful and willing to recommend restaurants and direct you around the city.

review.title: Good value with Expedia deal
review.reviewText: Very conv location. Quiet good sized room, beds and bathroom.Cornell the concierge very helpful provided you tip.Free internet to print boarding pass.Fantastic pre pay room deal with Expedia= half price.

review.title: Impressed but not blown away
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and it was in a great location. Nothing about it stood out but that is not necessarily a bad thing. The rooms were a decent size but very basic and the bathrooms were very nice.
