The bed was quite comfortable and the staff was very friendly although they did forget about our wake-up call one morning. Considering that you are a block or two from Union Square, it was quite quiet. Overall, if you want a clean, friendly, comfortable place to stay, then this is the place for you. If you are looking for a higher end hotel than I would look elsewhere.

review.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Would thoroughly recommend this hotel if you want a hotel room in a great central location-close to a tram stop which is a good way of getting around the city. The staff were superb,the room was spacious,modern and clean.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

review.title: Lovely little secret
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to China town, Fisherman's wharf and Embarcadero, shopping, many restaurants,etc. It was only a twenty minute drive to the airport. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, cozy and comfortable. My husband and I had a nice visit in San Francisco staying here.

review.title: Good stay at perfect location
review.reviewText: Room was quite nice, front desc stuff very polite and helpful. The location of the Orchard is just great: Cable Car around the corner, Union Square and Chinatown both in a walkable distance!

review.title: Comfortable hotel, great location
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic stay at the Orchard. The location was wonderful. A short walk down the hill to Union Square, short walk up the hill to Nob Hill, two blocks from the China Town gate, just steps from the Powell Street cable car lines and a short walk to the California line. 5 minute walk to Market Street and about 20 minutes or so from the Wharf and the Ferry Building. Room was large and bright, as was the bathroom. Bed was comfortable, neither too hard nor too soft. Pillows were a bit squishy for my tastes. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I'd definitely stay again on a return trip.

review.title: A San Francisco gem
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel 6 times and have never been disappointed. Rooms are nice and clean. Free internet and DVD service. Very centrally located. Staff always helpful.

review.title: Quaint and Classy
review.reviewText: Great Location. This hotel is within walking distance from cable cars, shopping,and restaurants. I advise booking your leisure arrangements through the hotel concierge. I would advise booking an Alcatraz trip prior to arrival otherwise you might not get a ticket.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was great and the staff was friendly. The rooms are clean and spacious. I will definetly stay there again.

review.title: Well placed hotel for access for SF sightseeing
review.reviewText: Location very handy for Union Square with its half price ticket booth and proximity to Powell St cable terminus. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Had a problem with the room safe though for which the maintenance man had some problems sorting out; otherwise the room was clean, roomy and quiet. No area to sit around reception though - simply a foyer and lift to rooms. However can't have everything I suppose!

review.title: Great little hotel in an excellent location.
review.reviewText: Great little hotel in an excellent location. Dining room was great and there is a very convenient and inexpensive shuttle that brings you to the SF airport.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, nice rooms, and really excellent friendly helpful staff.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights after driving from LA. Overall the hotel is clean and comfortable and it is an excellent location for shopping and eating. We were not impressed with the hotel breakfast and preferred Roxannes Cafe around the corner. The Valet parking was also extortionate at $40 per night. The staff were fairly friendly and as helpful as their limited english would allow.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Conveniently located near shopping, transportation and many of SF attractions. The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: I agree with all the positive things said about the Orchard Hotel. Would go back if I'm ever in San Francisco again.

review.title: Nice Hotel !!!
review.reviewText: They give good service in the frontdesk. I wish to go there again.

review.title: Great location and beautiful big rooms.
review.reviewText: Surprisingly fabulous. Very impressed.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Simple hotel but in a great location at a good price.

review.title: Great Location and Value
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in easy walking distance to everything! Prompt and courteous staff! Overall very satisfied with this hotel visit!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly, attentive staff, comfy room. Close to everything, but not as much street noise as some hotels in the area.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Comfortable bed. Large Spacious bathroom...no tub though so may be difficult if you have little kids. We loved that there was free dvd rental offered to you, which we used. There are robes to use which I always love and free internet service if your room. Great Place! No complaints. Close enough to area attractions.

review.title: great location and service
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room. Staff was friendly and helpful in providing info on restaurants nearby. Would stay there again and will recommend to friends.

review.title: Great location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Lovely room, great bathroom and v comfortable bed. Have already reccommended to others and hope to visit again. Breakfast a minor let down - much better value elsewhere but convenient and pleasant enough at the Orchard.

review.title: Very nice and perfect location
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was wonderful. The room was very spacious and comfortable, and all the staff were very friendly and they truly wanted to make your stay pleasant. The location couldn't have been better; a couple of blocks from Union Square. All types of transportation, including one's feet, available to get around. We truly enjoyed our trip and The Orchard Hotel was a big part of that.

review.title: Your reviews were right!
review.reviewText: We usually stay at another hotel while in S.F. but your reviews were so good that we decided to give the Orchard a shot. We were not disappointed! From the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff to the size and cleanliness of our room, there was nothing to dislike about this hotel. It is just a couple of blocks from Union Square, just 1/4 block from the cable car and easy to drive to from out of the city. Even the Avis return center is a just a few blocks away. We loved the hotel!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. Great location, Staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was very spacious, clean and new and the bed was the most comfortable we had on our whole trip!

review.title: Great location, Quaint, Quiet, Great Restaurant.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay would do it again. Clean comfortable rooms with a great bed. Ask for a room with a Bush Street view. Cable car stop on the corner within steps right on Powell Street. Convenient to Union Square, China Town and Little Italy. The daffodil Restaurant in the Hotel was excellent. Food was great and the wine list was good. Many dishes had wine pairings by the glass. Perfect.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Managed to get a great rate through Expedia but would be willing to pay much more to stay at this hotel. Terrific central location but still very quiet. Guest rooms very clean and good size. Above-average bathrooms. Would be very happy to stay there again when next in SF.

review.title: Great find in superb location!!
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was every bit as comfortable as the big fancy Union Square hotel that I satyed in last year. The hotel is on the Southeast corner of the intersection of Powell and Bush Street with the entrance about 70 yards east on Powell on Bush on the South Side of the street. To get to Union Square, you just walk out the door, to the left and down the hill on Powell for 2 blocks. On this very short walk, you encounter a Starbucks, a Seattle's Best (inside Borders), Sears Fine Foods, Michael Mina (fine dining inside the Westin), Lori's Diner, and many other food options. If you choose to make a right turn, you are greeted by the ChinaTown Gate on your left just a short block away. There is a Starbucks and Cafe De La Presse a very short distance down Bush Street as well. Noise level in the room was non-existant. Bed was very comfortable. TV/DVD player was inside a built in opposite the foot of the bed. Hotel DVD selection was actually very recent. The staff was eager to give maps, directions, public transit info, etc. No need for a car in SF, if you want an excursion, just book a rental car daily or just when you need it, almost all agencies have a deck in the Union Square Area. The only negative was the fact that when we arrived, both elevators were out of service and the staff seemed at a loss, as they did not even suggest we leave our bags with them and offer to bring them up later. So we got some excersize, not a bad thing after a long day of travel.

review.title: great hotel friendly staff
review.reviewText: stayed at this hotel as a girls weekend. found the room was excellent very comfortable-beds and pillows were great. the staff was really friendly and accomadating. will definatly go back

review.title: Superior SF Experience
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay both on business and lesiure. Location is great and rooms are delightful.

review.title: Best deal in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great price, beautiful hotel, nice amenities, free movies, friendly service. This is the best hotel experience I've had in San Francisco at a fraction of the price for big chain or trendier hotels. Great location too.

review.title: Friendly, clean, comfortable and convenient.
review.reviewText: A lovely, reasonably-priced escape. Everyone at the desk was friendly and helpful and cheery. Certainly a convenient location. We're looking forward to staying there again.

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Great location and great room for the price paid! Very comfortable bed.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Not expensive...exceeded expectations......great location.

review.title: San Francico Best of the Best
review.reviewText: Best place away from home. Pillows ,bed amenities excellent just like a 5 start hotel. We being going to Orchard for the past 2 yrs. I will return again.

review.title: outstanding value for money
review.reviewText: convinient,comfortable and friendly.excellent value, good breakfast.will definately stay there again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a perfect location. Everybody was very helpful. The only negative comment is that even do the bathroom was big it only had a shower, no tube, which it would have been helpful for relaxation after all the walking we did during the day.

review.title: A very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Location was brilliant, staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is great. Would go back if I ever visit San Fran again.

review.title: Awesome hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was extremely comfortable, in a great location, and the staff was the best! Especially Davis the doorman. One complaint..the breakfast buffet increased in price from 10$ to 14$ during the middle of our stay. Unfortunately, we were not informed until after we had eaten. We felt we should have been notified of a substantial change in price.

review.title: Great hotel and convinient location
review.reviewText: Hotel room was very clean (free smoking business) and the bed sheets smelled fresh, making me feel physically relaxed and satified. The complimentary wi-fi provided in room was also very helpful in quick surfing the area around before going out. We were happy to stay at the Orhcard Hotel, warm and comfortable. We parked our on street in front of the hotel for free on Saturday night and Sunday, until we left at noon.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: Very good and everyone are very nice. the only minor point is that the shower could have a stronger flow of water, at least in the room I stayed (404)

review.title: Delightful hotel stay!
review.reviewText: We're two active retirees and decided on the Orchard Hotel after reading reviews written by others...great choice! Immaculate, welcoming and helpful staff, convenient and safe location, quiet throughout and no sleep interruptions, accessible to cable car line, dining choices,shopping, churches, small market and pharmacy nearby. Spacious room and bathroom, comfy bed and pillows, WIFI access in room and at hotel desk. We did not have good luck with breakfast in the dining room; poor service, food just 'okay', and costly. The continental breakfast at $10/day was a better choice than ordering from the menu. Overall, we loved this hotel, will return, and highly recommend....again, the staff is terrific and made us feel 'at home'.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: We spent a little more than our budget to stay at the Orchard but it was totally worth it. The Hotel was clean and in a great location - the Cable car stop to Fishermans Wharf is right out side the hotel and Union Square is 2 blocks away. There are lots of nice moderately priced restaurants with in a few minutes walk. We'd definitely go back to the Orchard if we returned to San Francisco. The only problem was the bed was just so comfy - it made it difficult to get up in the morning!!!

review.title: Very Accomodating
review.reviewText: Picked the right hotel. It was clean, with in-room safe, huge bathroom, free wired/wireless internet access, free dvd-rentals, cable TV. The hotel was also in the center of where everything else was located, in walking distance. The staff was friendly in and out of the hotel. What I especially liked about this hotel was that they helped me and my girlfriend book a winery tour last minute. We were skeptical about making our own decisions and booking the tour ourselves. We asked the staff for recommendations, and they suggested a good choice. We asked them to book the tour the night before, and we were happy to get a seating for the bus. So glad that everything worked out. The hotel made our short sweet vacation a pleasurable experience. We never tried the breakfast, so I can not say much about that.

review.title: Great sheets and comfortable beds
review.reviewText: The rooms were large and the beds were very comfortable and the sheets were fabulous! The breakfast in the morning was also very nice. ALl in all a positive experience and great value. Perfect for a business traveler.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hospitality was poor

review.title: A great Hotel
review.reviewText: A very good location on a quiet side street. A good boutique hotel with a very comfortable room and helpful staff.

review.title: Nice Location for walkers and riders
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice from the bell hop to the cleaning staff. The hotel is in a good location for riding the cable car or for walking if you can negoiate the steep hills of S.F. I would stay here again on another visit to S.F. for business or for a weekend getaway with my wife. Highly suggested as a great boutique hotel experience.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in excellent location best of both worlds, walking distance to almost everthing if you like to walk if not transport is all around. We choose this Hotel on the Expedia recomendations and they were all exceeded. Would definately stay again.

review.title: lackluster
review.reviewText: overall impression satisfactory but lacking in a distinct flavor as if the hotel had charisma bypass surgery. Mini bar items strangely stale and antique; 'surround sound' of audio system not arranged in any coherent sense. I get the impression they been languishing in their own success. This hotel needs to be reinvented. 'Boutique' hotel which has gone stale.

review.title: Very comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: Although the hotel itself was a bit small the room was in great condition. The bed was fabulous. Feather pillows, down comforter and very clean.

review.title: Fantastic Location, Great Servise
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located and just a short walk from the cable car and all main attractions are nearby.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: An excellent find, the room was big and very comfortable. The $10 cold buffet was good value. All in all a cracking hotel and well recommended.

review.title: Good place to stay in SFO
review.reviewText: Good place to stay in SFO. Excellent location. Clean and comfortable rooms. Good size bathrooms. In room safe big enough to fit a laptop and fast free internet access.

review.title: Simply the best
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, the staff are very helpful ,rooms are clean, comfortable and service is spot on.Real value for money.

review.title: amazing hotel! an excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed in the Orchard hotel in March 02 until March 06, 2008. The hotel is so good!! I came to the hotel from recommendations i read here before. Thank you people! The hotel and rooms are very clean, the location is superb, the staff is so nice!!!!! They have a free selection of DVD movies in the reception and you can choose what movie you want to see in your room. yes, there is a DVD player in the room. if you have a laptop so there is also free surfing in your room. They really give attention to little details and make you to feel comfortable. I stayed in many hotels and this hotel is special. We enjoyed San Francisco a lot and the maps the give in the room are very good. Near the hotel there are: supermarket, Union Square, Laundromat, and all the transportation you need. I recommend this hotel to everyone who comes to San Francisco and when I come back, I will stay there again! It was great!

review.title: a lucky find! highly recommend. a great value.
review.reviewText: we needed a last minute hotel room in san franciso for a family emergency. to our dismay, the city was fully booked with a huge convention. it seemed nothing was available in the 5-4 star, union square area. never heard of orchard hotel. am so glad we ended up there. staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. front desk, porters, barstaff... all were relaxed but not clueless. location is actually a plus. boutique hotel on a residential street. the only thing which might matter... and I think it does.... is that windows don't open. the room is sealed. no fresh air. breakfast/brunch can be had at the corner in a great little bistro, watching the cable cars go by. there is limited room service in the hotel which we didn't try. we had a dinner of appetizers at the bar one evening. again, limited, but satisfying. wretched trip to our hometown mitigated by a good hotel.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and convenient hotel with helpful and friendly staff

review.title: A pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Good to excellent

review.title: Good as review
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying.

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient to Union Square shopping. The cable cars and a Muni pass can get you anywhere in the city--a car is more of a hindrance than a necessity with parking very expensive if you can find it. The room was comfortable and the Aveda products a nice touch. My only problem was a mini bar lock that would not work.

review.title: The Orchard Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel. Decor and furnishings are very nice, room very comfortable. Location is great, a few steps from the trolley line, short walk to Union Square and shopping, taxis readily available. Staff very friendly and helpful. Many dining choices nearby.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the Market District
review.reviewText: This hotel was situated on the north side of the Market District. As first timers to San Francisco, it was a little difficult to find. When we arrived, we were instantly helped with our bags. The valet service is probably your best option as parking in this area is limited. Be prepared to pay a significant amount for parking in the area. Once inside, the room was very clean and elegant. The bed was large and cozy, and included a down comforter. The bathroom was large and well stocked. The only thing I was disappointed in was the view. Looking out my window all I could see was an office building right across the way, and I could see people working away at their desks. Other than that, I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. I highly recommend staying here!

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Orchard Hotel could not have been better. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Our room was very clean and spacious. The English breakfast was also quite nice. The hotel also provided a car that took us to the airport on our way home. We will definitely be staying at The Orchard when we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Quality Hotel
review.reviewText: Room on 7th floor, road side,expected noise, very quiet. Continental breakfast included, very plentifull. Rooms very clean and looked after by a most efficent staff. Without exception all members of staff helpfull and accommodating. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Good bear bones hotel in nice location
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a nice, relatively inexepensive boutique hotel near Union Square, this is a fine choice. The rooms are pretty clean, the beds very comfortable. There are Aveda products in the bathroom. On the downside, there is ZERO room in the lobby, so don't plan on doing anything there other than checking in. Probably the smallest lobby I've ever seen. Not even room for a full-size couch. Also, there is just basic cable -- no movies. All hotels calling themselves 4 stars should also now have flat screens as mandatory -- not here. Lastly, there are no amenities. No gym. No lounge. No spa. No room WiFi. Nothing but a mediocre restaruant (it does have room service). OVerall, if you want a good deal in Union Square and just a place to sleep, this is a fine choice. If you demand functionality from your hotel, look elsewhere.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel based purely on price, but found a gem. 1. The location is perfect, right on the cable-car line to fisherman's wharf, within easy walking distance of the downtime shops and other travel routes. We drove there from Yosemite and were a little worried about finding it when we arrived at S.F, but it's only about 10 minutes very straightforward drive from the freeway exit. 2. I travel constantly with work, and yet have rarely stayed in a hotel where the staff were so friendly and eager to please. They gave us invaluable information on the best places to visit, the best times, and where to get bargain tickets. 3. The breakfasts were lovely! freshly cooked pastries and cakes. Very tasty.

review.title: Generally great except for doorman/concierge service levels.
review.reviewText: Service from some of the front desk staff and concierge was wanting: indifferent to a "middle-aged" female, somewhat contemptuous attitude overall. I would still recommend the hotel to someone looking for convenience, decent room size and a relatively new/clean environment. Plus the included breakfasts were very good, with lots of fresh fruit and excellent coffee.

review.title: Nice clean hotel, great service
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very nice location in SF. It is clean & comfortable.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Very clean, comfortable. Large rooms. Helpful, friendly staff. Very nice continentasl breakfast included.

review.title: Convienient and Comfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Orchard for a week. Its very centrally located, close to the cable car stop and within walking distance to most shops and plenty of restaurants.The hotel staff are friendly an dhelpful. Breakfast is very basic but there are plenty of cafes close by.Not too impressed by the restaurant either - I personally think it was over priced and food was not that great.So best to avoid eating in. Another bonus is the free internet.

review.title: What a wonderful place!
review.reviewText: Everything about my stay was fantastic. The service, the room, the location.

review.title: Nice small hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was fantastic with the exception of complimentary breakfastin the restaurant, which was mediocre and always overcrowded.

review.title: Great location/great stuff
review.reviewText: The cons: I thought the platform bed was a bit uncomfortable (no box spring), but the people I was staying with said they were fine. Also, the continental breakfast is (as can probably be expected) less than decadent. Just mostly bread, bagels, and watermelon. But you get free DVDs, the rooms/hotel are beautiful, and free internet access. They'll even supply you with an ethernet cable if you forgot yours.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in a good position for the cable car, buses and shops. The staff were very friendly and helpful, would definitely stay again.

review.title: Personal and like Home
review.reviewText: The hotel offered great accommodations. Free internet access, free continental breakfast and dvd rentals for your stay. Something that other hotels would charge you for.

review.title: Perfect for business travelers - slept like a rock.
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and the staff nice and helpful. Great to have a restaurant in the hotel and have access to room service if need be. Loved the Sleep 101 CD available for insomniacs!

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: Found this hotel to be great value and very convenient to shopping and central city activities. We only stayed one night but would definitely stay again if we returned to San Francisco. The room was well equipped and quiet. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and the limousine service available to the hotel is value for money.

review.title: Great location/comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Location terrific for exploring San Francisco. You can walk anywhere downtown, China Town, Ferry Building, and hop on the cable car to get to Fisherman's Wharf. We'll definitely be back.

review.title: next visit
review.reviewText: I have stayed in many San Fran hotels and they have mostly all been a bit "tired" this hotel and its staff was great. It will now be my San Fran hotel.

review.title: Fourth Straight Year and we'll be back for Five
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our fourth annual stay at the Orchard. We time our weekend vist around but not right on Valentines Day. The location is great for feeling like a part of busy San Francisco while at the same time away from the hustle and bustle of a major 4 star mega box.This hotel is close to everything within a few short blocks; the Mason Powell cable car line, Chinatown, Downtown, which features the best shopping in San Francisco, a Walgreens for those forgotten items and oh yeah Starbucks. The litle touches of the hotel, like a surround sound system, helps us feel right at home, we bring our own music to set the mood,and relax in the finest robes we ever put on our bodies. There is free movie rentals for when we want to wind down and relax with a bottle of whatever floats our boat. The bathrooms are spacious, and are stocked with Aveda products. The help as always was top notch, and the owner is readily available most mornings during the continental breakfast. Speaking of which, the breakfast is the weakest part if the whole experience, but does offer the convenience when you just want to grab a tidbit and not sweat a long wait elsewhere. There may be other more glamourous properties, with lots of bells and whistles, but staying at the Orchard makes us both feel like we are truly getting away from it all while visiting a truly alive city.

review.title: Quiet, comfortable and unpretentious
review.reviewText: We've stayed in many hotels but this rates very high on our list. We often have trouble sleeping because of outside noise and general hotel noise, TVs etc but this is very quiet. We were unaware of other guests at all. The bed was enormous by UK standards and very comfortable. The room size is good with a larger than average bathroom. Overall this is an unpretentious place with very helpful staff and well located for downtown and general transport - including the cablecars! The free breakfast was fine but the same every day. We loved San Francisco and would stay at the Orchard again.

review.title: Bed quality spoils otherwise very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is quiet and in a great location, and the rooms are very clean. The complimentary internet access and breakfast (selection is highly limited, but hey, it's free) are a rarity in decent San Francisco hotels. They also use "real" TVs and DVD players, as opposed to the "hotel" kind, where you order movies. There is a complimentary DVD library. All of which makes it a mystery why they don't bother to use box springs under the mattresses. The platform beds are low enough to accomodate them, and would be significantly more comfortable. A soft mattress with a rigid support really does not make for a nice bed. Unfortunately, a week of sleepless nights means no measure of friendly staff and amenities would make me return here.

review.title: Thoroughly satisfied.
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel is lovely boutique hotel within close proximity of Union Square. The rooms are much larger than most hotels in San Francisco and are spotless and very comfortable. They are also extremely quiet. I would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the Orchard Hotel. The hotel was centrally located and very quiet. We thought it deserves at least a 4 star rating.

review.title: Great location, quality for the price
review.reviewText: Great for both a business and a pleasure hotel, right on the Powell cable line near Union Square. The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are completely clean and functional, great shower and a real nice breakfast, every morning. This brand new hotel is perfect if you want to avoid the big hotel scene and enjoy a great little boutique hotel in downtown SF.

review.title: A must stay hotel
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great-2 blocks from union-square,cable-car stop footsteps away from hotel.Hotel-staff was very helpful,professional and friendly.Very tasty breakfast in the morning. I was very happy with my 4 day stay at the orchard hotel and would stay there again.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: Lovely place in every way. Nice restuarant. convenient location with cable car stop on same block. Only problem was early check out(5:30am)retrieving our rental car. Valet cars were kept off property and they brought us the wrong car. Mistake was corrected but glad we left extra time to get to the airport!

review.title: Great Location, Great Service
review.reviewText: Just blocks away from Union Square and Chinatown, the Orchard is a great place to be based in SFO. The Cable-Car to Fisherman's Wharf practically stops at the front door and even North Beach is a short walk away through Chinatown. James, the doorman, is an invaluable source of local info. Great complimentary breakfast too!

review.title: Can't Beat It!
review.reviewText: Very impressed! From the friendliness of the staff--even the owner herself, Mrs. Huang--to the comfort of the room and its amenities. The bed, down comforter and down pillows were great, as was the large, very clean bathroom. The free hi-speed Internet is a nice plus, along with complimentary robes and room safe. Our room was very quiet and spacious, and it was nice to have a coffee-maker in the room with a selection of delicious coffees and teas. Our favorite thing was the complimentary European-style continental breakfast which was awesome! Also, Chinatown is just two blocks away. This hotel provides a lot of value for the money, and I will certainly be staying there again on my next visit.

review.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Orchard Hotel was in a great location, all personnel were friendly and helpful, restaurant in hotel convenient for breakfast. The room we stayed in was large, very clean, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was big and very, very clean. The hotel was on the corner of a Cable Car stop and two blocks away from the bus line, which made getting to attractions very easy. All in all it was a great place to say and I would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great hotel. Great location!
review.reviewText: We will definitely stay at the Orchard again. The location (Nob Hill) is very central and very convenient. The room was clean and comfortable. I would highly recomment the Orchard.

review.title: Dissappointing
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel after reading the glowing reviews from other Expedia customers. They downgraded me to twin beds when I had booked a king. The beds are platform style and therefore on the hard side. Not exactly what I had planned. Parking was expensive, at $38 per day, plus tipping the valet.

review.title: The best hotel experience of my life...!
review.reviewText: It may not be the largest or most well known in SF, but this hotel is the finest and most well kept that I've ever seen. The staff became so familiar in only 3 days - they were a bit like family and it was bittersweet to leave. The rooms were beautiful - from the comfort of the pillows to the beauty and size of a bathroom you could play basketball in! And clean, clean, clean. I can't stress this one enough. Nothing was worn or dirty. And I'm pretty funny about a clean bathroom. I took my sister for our last outing before she moved out of state. It was a perfect place for us. Close to the Square, Chinatown, the cable car (1/2 block) and the restaurants. I can't reccomend this hotel enough. I can't wait to return soon.

review.title: Great location; highly recommended
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and spacious room with safe. Large and beautiful bathroom. High speed internet and nice buffet breakfast included. Service was excellent. Less than 1/2 block from main cable car line. Only problem for us was the beds were too firm. We requested and got mattress toppers that worked reasonably well, but were bulky. We'd certainly go back.

review.title: Great hotel for your stay San Francisco for both business and leisure
review.reviewText: Very good hotel, not to big, just right. Only imperfection is the noise of the trash pick-up early in the morning, if you have a room located at the back site of the hotel

review.title: Great SF experience
review.reviewText: Excellent service and value.

review.title: A San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: I am always on the look-out for a clean, comfortable, convenient, friendly, quiet, upscale-contemporary Hotel when I travel, (since I travel alot). Recently in SFO for business, this was a real find. Not only was the bellman helpful and friendly but the desk staff also. The I-Net connection was a breeze (available on any floor), and its free! They give you a password at check-in and cables, if needed. They also have a DVD movie library available. I also loved having a CD player to listen to music in the evening. Since this is a newly constructed Hotel, they installed special double pane windows that muffle the sound and although the cable car bell could be heard during the day, it was very quiet at night. The down comforter and pillows were a treat and the second pillow is not down (in case you are allergic). Our room was spacious and everything said in other reviews is true. It was a nice suprise to have Aveda products in the bath, robes and Frette linens on the bed! If you are in need of a small meeting room, their Boardroom is "state of the art", with no extra charges for wireless. Parking; valet at $38, is normal. You are in the city. Stay up the hill a little ways and it is $50 per night! Continental breakfast was perfect. Even with the tons of wonderful eateries close by, we stopped in one evening for a light dinner and drinks at the restaurant and had the most wonderful foie Gras and seared scallops. We will definately be back!

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: Location is excellent, being right next to the Powell cable car line. Within walking distance of many of the San Francisco sights. Hotel was very clean and well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful. Room was quiet with very little street noise. This is a non-smoking hotel which was a plus in my eyes. The complimentary continental breakfast was very good.

review.title: One of the better hotels.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Good rates, friendly staff and lots of freebies. Clean and spacious rooms. Will stay again.

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: Perfect location, great breakfast, right on the cable car line

review.title: Feels like home
review.reviewText: From the moment we were greeted by the doorman we knew we were in for a treat.  Staff is welcoming and accommodating. The rooms are quiet and comfortable with above average furnishings.  There are several nice touchs: an internet connected computer for guests in the lobby, free continental breakfast, free newspaper, access to town cars for trips to airport (worth the cost)and a staff that is happy to give you directions and advice on sightseeing.  The location is perfect: few blocks from Chinatown, Union Square, easy access to cable car and BART.  I would definitely stay here again!
